23230729.review:
Year Walk is a game with an extremely unique presentation. So much so that I am unsure whether I consider it to be a traditional adventure game, a walking sim, or its own tiny subgenre. If it is a walking sim, it is one of the best I've played.
The plot is simple, or at least straightforward. You want to see the future, so you perform an ancient Swedish folklore ritual that lets you see the future, called the Year Walk. During this time you will walk around the forest surrounding your cabin, helping the various spirits that live there. Once you have helped them all, they let you see the Church Grimm, who shows you the future. The climax of the game is abstract, maybe unfittingly so, but at the end it shows you that your friend will get injured and might also die. Incidentally, this friend is the one that told you not to perform the Year Walk. I suppose that we are supposed to learn a lesson about not messing with powers beyond your understanding, but I had so much fun that I would be tempted to year walk anyway. 
The most immediately apparent aspect of Year Walk is its art direction, particularly its color palette. This game contains many horror elements, and it can easily be classified as a horror game. Despite that, the color palette is quite bright, with a strong emphasis on cyan and white. It's also very desaturated, creating an atmosphere that is usually serene and peaceful, but can instantly change to be scary and desolate. The characters have similarly stylized designs. They are awe-inspiring and spooky, but also approachable, even cute (except the Huldra). The Brook Horse and Church Grimm are the standout designs, and I think the designer knew this, as the Church Grimm's icons are used frequently throughout the game. In fact, the game is icon-heavy in general, with each creature having a distinct symbol, almost like a hieroglyph.
I only have three complaints, so I will just list them. First, the navigation of Year Walk is unusual; it's from a first person perspective, but movement is restricted to 2d planes. The player scuttles from side to side like a crab, and can only walk forward and backward onto new planes in certain spaces. This is fine, even fun, but on certain screens I could get a headache if I walked too fast from side to side. I don't consider this to be the game's fault necessarily, but if a game causes me physical distress I want to note it. My other two complaints have to do with two specific puzzles. Most of the puzzles are actually very good, and the hint system is one of the best I've ever seen, but there are only two notable exceptions. The first puzzle is when the player is trying to open a furnace. The furnace door is locked, and the only way to open it is to press the corresponding keys on the keyboard to what is engraved on the locks. This might sound obvious in retrospect, but since those keys are not used before or since, it bothers me that the solution is so strange. The last problem I had was with the Huldra's maze: it is a puzzle where the player is expected to listen to aural queues, and the background music of the section is about as loud as the queues.
I don't really have much more to say about Year Walk. The art design is great, the mechanics are finally crafted, and the story is unique and educational. Even the achievements are meaningful. Anyone who is a fan of atmospheric horror, mythology, or adventure games in general should absolutely check it out.

22981377.review:
Очень угрюмая и пессимистичная игра о блуждании по снегу. Концовка вас не устроит, так как она не описана полностью — додумывай сам. В центре сюжета находится теория о путешествии во времени. Вот только нет такого понятия, как 'время'. И тут не описывается ни как оно работает, ни что случилось с героями, ни в чём вообще смысл.

Самое глупое то, что всё встаёт на свои места только после полного прохождения, а до того не имеет никакого смысла и толку. Вы не понимаете куда идти, что делать, зачем делать и т.д. Для решения пазлов постоянно приходится пользоваться руководством.

Короче, сначала вам нужно часа 2-3 проходить в первый раз, получив ровно НОЛЬ фана, затем прочитать здоровенный дневник разработчика, а потом ещё пару часов пытаться в уме сложить всё в одну теорию. И только уже потом, когда вы второй раз начнёте проходить всё заново, станут понятны все отсылки, события, существа и т.д. Вот только в чём соль такого действа? Я даже не знаю, кому это можно рекомендовать.

Единственная отличительная черта игры — абнормальное количество положительных отзывов, написанных задним числом. А может просто я слишком религиозно подкован и меня такое не пробрало. Получается, что игра создана для людей, которые верят в существование всякой чертовщины, но не верят в истинного Бога. Идеал для буддистов.

За последнюю неделю купил пару хоррор-игр и Year Walk пожалуй стала лучшей среди всех мною купленных. Да и по правде, на данный момент, данная игра для меня чуть ли не лучшая в жанре хоррор. Она не берет скримерами (но они есть, 2-3), она берет своей шикарной атмосферой под сопровождение прекрасного саундтрека. Но и по правде, скример-моменты довели меня до жесткого испуга, т.к. игра спокойная, не динамичная, и ты следовательно расслабляешься, а  тут, на тебе... Кирпичи готовы. Загадки, тут слов не хватит дабы описать какие они шикарные и не легкие. После прохождения всех концовок (ВНИМАНИЕ! Она не одна, да-да ;)) остается двоякое впечатление. Первое - страх, второе - Черт подери, игра шикарна. Не даром я ее проходил, да и еще в 2 часа ночи. Обязательно перепройду ее еще пару раз. Так же кстати, мне понравилось то, что после 1-го прохождения, есть якобы послание, благодаря которому появляется доступ к дневнику, который и открывает глаза на происходящее.

В общем, оценка данной игре 10 из 10. Она правда шикарна.

공포 게임이 갑자기 확 끌려서 약 1주 전에 나눔받은 'Year Walk'를 플레이해봤습니다.
 
간략하게 게임 소개를 하자면, 스웨덴 민간 신앙인 '일 년 산책'을 소재로 한 게임입니다.
게임에서 소재가 되는 '일 년 산책'과 '숲의 마녀', '동자귀' 등 갖은 민간 신앙의 특징을 잘 살렸다고 생각되는 게임이었습니다.
스토리도 제법 괜찮았고, 특히 구성이 좋더군요.
분위기와 어울리는 OST와 그래픽까지...
 
태그에 공포가 걸려있지만 공포보다는 신비로운 느낌에 더 가까웠습니다.
개인적으로 공포 게임을 못 해서 시작하기 전에는 조금 걱정도 있었는데, 정도가 약해서 좋더군요.
도전과제도 1회차 이후 2회차 때 모두 쉽게 클리어 가능해서 단숨에 깨버렸네요.
약한 공포물 좋아하시는 분들, 미신에 관심이 많으신 분들, 도전과제 클리어를 좋아하시는 분들께 추천드리고 싶은 게임입니다.
 
끝으로, 좋은 게임 나눔해주신 'Jedong'님께 감사드립니다.

22631611.review:
[i]Хочу передать большое спасибо Антону за то, что он подарил мне эту милую игру. Ты чудо :1 [/i]


[quote]И это безмятежное место вскоре окрасится кровью.	[/quote]

[b]Прогулка сквозь годы[/b] - это инди игрушка в жанре [u]приключенческий хоррор[/u]. Она рассказывает нам одну скандинавскую легенду, в которой люди, ради пророчества готовы были пойти на страшное испытание. Наш главный герой, а точнее Дэниэл Свенсон, отчаянно решается пройти этот некий обряд ради своей дорогой возлюбленной - Стины. Там он встречается с 5 мифическими существами (The Huldra, The Brook Horse, The Myling, The Night Raven и The Church Grim) , которых нужно будет "победить" путем решения достаточно легких головоломок. Эти мифические существа полностью черпались из шведских старинных преданий, что сделало игру более интересной. В игре присутствует энциклопедия, в которой можно будет получить небольшую информацию о каждом из них. Прекрасная музыка, от Daniel Olsén и Jonathan Eng никак нам не дает расслабиться и отвлечься  от игры - постоянно держит нас в напряжении. Охх. Как прекрасно поет эта Хульдра..
Эта игра заслуживает внимания. Доводит до мурашек своей необычностью и таинственностью.
Сам геймплей идет на 2-3 часика, но этого нам будет достаточно, чтобы полюбить Year Walk и перепройти ее еще раз.

22597651.review:
[Game originally played on iOS]

If you're looking for a review to determine if this is a game worthy of your time, I'll cut you the search: yes, it absolutely is. I'll get more into my thoughts on the game itself below.

However.

I can't believe I'm saying this, but if you own an iPhone or iPad, get that version instead.
There are a lot of puzzles that make a lot more sense and that are a lot more clever with touch controls. There's no reason not to at least pick that version up first. The visuals are identical, it's a few bucks cheaper, and the controls are arguably better when actually using your fingers to swipe across the environment.

As for the game itself, it's a stellar game. For such a short runtime, Year Walk shows an interesting world and builds a genuinely fascinating and creepy atmosphere. The visuals are absolutely gorgeous and really compliment that atmosphere. The story is also really clever and doesn't overstay it's welcome. Much like the original Portal, it's short, sweet, and gets it's point across with no distractions. All killer, no filler.

Absolutely pick this game up if it looks up your alley. Again, I'd urge you to try the iOS version first if you have that option available to you. If not, the PC release is absolutely fine, with only sometimes fiddly controls and a few surprises neutered in the process. I highly recommend Year Walk.

22302540.review:
First ever review so here goes:

This was a three person project with one man taking on development, music, and research respectively.  The team clearly made it their goal to stay true to the folk lore of Year Walking (evidenced by the in-game encyclopedia and a journal that you'll learn of on your own) as well as various supernatural elements of Swedish myth.  The game took me around 2 hours to complete, including a secret that will involve some reading but made me cherish this game even more (if it's not clear I really liked this game).  The music was beautiful, with a light-hearted melody toward the start, but most of it was quite foreboding.  The gameplay was very simple, it is point and click with the only movement being left, right, forward and back.  The UI is very simple and stays out of the way of what I thought to be very nice visuals. The puzzles are all well-thought with one in particular that made me look up the hints you can find in-game.  On the subject of hints, they're all intentionally vague, more like advice than a concrete answer which keeps them from feeling cheap in my opinion.  The game has a good story, told neatly with no superfluous details or characters and it really got me at the climax.  The game is short but promises to keep you transfixed for its entirety.

22164097.review:
Year Walk is one of the most interesting and unique experiences I have had in gaming for a very long time. It's a first person adventure horror game based around the little known Swedish folklore of the "year walk", a ritual where individuals go without food and drink all day and then wander the woods at midnight, hoping to gain visions of the future but also potentially encountering dangerous supernatural beings. As such, the setting and story are fantastic and really draw you into the game. The great soundtrack, creepy sound effects, and unique visual style that looks like a mix between a pop-up book and a silent film help to enhance the setting even further and make this game a very emotional experience. While playing Year Walk, I truly felt the sensation of being all alone in a dark forest. In this way, the game was simultaneously comforting and terrifying in a way that I can't quite explain. Another enjoyable aspect of the game is that it essentially drops you into an open world and leaves you to explore and solve puzzles on your own, much like Myst or The Witness.

Overall, I highly recommend Year Walk. It's an experience not easily forgotten and best played on a dark snowy evening with a good set of headphones.

22108920.review:
9/10. A short but extremely satisfying game with excellent visuals and mood.

Firstly, I loved the visual style of this game - the 2D illustrations are incredibly beautiful. I also loved the way 2D blended into 3D in terms of gameplay from a first-person perspective. While disorienting at first, I think that is intentional and it works well with the fact that the game itself blurs the lines of time and space.

The Swedish folklore this game is based upon is rather enthralling too, and I greatly appreciated the little encyclopedia that works in-game. That you have to understand basic folklore to play the game is a wonderful approach.

The puzzles are strange and challenging, but not so difficult as to discourage casual players. 

Also, the sound design is excellent and provides for a truly immersive experience. As is the secret mini-game after the first 'ending', which leads to the true ending.

Despite being able to complete the whole game in only three hours, this was well worth the full price for me. And the game has really stuck with me as being a moving experience and work of art.

Мне, как человеку, не знакомому со шведским фольклором, было безумно любопытно погрузиться в заснеженный лес и стать частью языческого обряда. На решение всех загадок у меня ушёл полностью исписанный лист А4. Первое прохождение делалось не глядя на внутриигровую карту, поэтому мной была нарисована собственная, это явно пошло на пользу впечатлениям от игры: блуждания в поисках по лесу по самодельной карте, тьма неясных символов, загадочные силы, ожидание откровения по завершению прогулки, да ещё и сильное давление на реальность происходящего ближе к концу игры... 

Игра оставляет после себя очень приятные впечатления, как после прохождения FEZ. Сто процентов в будущем перепройду её заново.

21271988.review:
Every once in a while, I find myself in a mood that makes me want to experience something different; when such a thing happens, I take a peek at a game that doesn't look like a typical game; that neither plays, nor feels, like one; a game such as Year Walk.
A chill and dark venture into Swedish folklore, Year Walk consists of a series of pleasant and simple puzzles, all set under the frame of a forest; but as the title suggests, the core of the game is rather in the walking and immersing yourself in a very unique acoustic and visual landscape, and in the story that unfolds as you progress. Do not let yourself be fooled by the "horror" tag some people have put the game under; this is anything but a horror game despite - or rather because of - its exploring of a dark folklore.
Year Walk isn't just another video game, in that you won't have fun going through it. You will experience something.
Have you ever encountered an Owl in the middle of a forest, at night? Stood silent in the dark, your breathing suddenly becoming less of an automatism, while these two bright eyes were staring at you? It is a very precious feeling; one that games such as Year Walk try to convey... and sometimes succeed in doing so.

Wow ! Un de mes jeux préfèrés, malgré le fait qu'il soit très court.
Year Walk est un jeu avec une âme, une vrai.

Le jeu en lui même est très beau, pour peu qu'on aime le style graphique. Il y a une réele atmosphère, et la réalisation est très soignée, ce qui fait qu'on est vraiment absorbé dans l'univers. J'aime beaucoup aussi le choix du format, très allongé horizontallement, je ne sais pas pourquoi mais ça me donne tout de suite l'impression d'être dans un conte. Ajoutez à cela la qualité de l'ambiance sonore, vous avez déjà une petite perle.

Le gameplay est a l'image du visuel : à la fois simple, mais mine de rien, original et bien pensé. En soi les déplacements se font en side-scrolling, mais on a quand même le sentiment d'une dimension en plus quand on passe d'un plan a l'autre, grâce à la parallaxe et à la carte (qui devient rapidement indispensable), et c'est quelque chose que j'ai trouvé très habillement intégré par rapport à d'autres jeux du genre. 
Un point que certains trouveront sûrement négatif, c'est qu'on peut vite se perdre ou tourner en rond, les décors étant semblables, mais l'accès à la carte etant assez facile, je n'ai pas ressenti cela négativement. Pour moi celà donne vraie une homogénéité à l'atmosphère, et puis après tout, ça fait un peu partie de l'idée de se perdre dans les bois...
Seul petit bémol : pas de changement possible en clavier azerty, il faut se dépatouiller avec wasd ou les bonnes vieilles touches directionnelles, pas top vu qu'on utilise aussi la souris.

Venons-en au coeur du jeu : l'histoire. Basée sur le folklore scandinave et ses créatures fantastiques, elle est simple et pourtant subtile. Sans vouloir en dire trop, le secret qui ajoute une réelle profondeur au scénario, so keep walking...
Les énigmes quant à elles m'ont semblées bien dosées, pas extrêmement dure mais pas immédiates non plus, mais surtout bien integrées à l'histoire.

Je ne saurais que vous conseiller ce jeu, malgré sa durée de vie (2 heures en prenant mon temps), il vaut vraiment le coup.
Pour ma part en tout cas, ça a été un vrai régal, et je n'éspère qu'une chose : jouer à d'autres jeux comme celui-ci !

20898148.review:
Year Walk is a beautiful, unique experience, and despite its length, it is well worth the price. While this is considered a horror game, its primary draw is its clever puzzles and deceptively quaint and calming atmosphere that seem to take some inspiration from Tim Burton films. The sound design is excellent; both the music and sound effects are extremely crisp and know exactly when to go all out and when to draw back. There are even some music-based puzzles that will rely on your sense of pitch to be able to solve. However, most of the game is very quiet, with little to no music in many sections (though what music is there is quite well done), and only the eerily realistic sound of footsteps crruching in the thick snow will accompany you.

One of the key selling points of the game is its focus on Swedish folklore, which is told through a companion app (included in the Steam version) and, while it is not necessary to read, I highly recommend going through it so you will know about the different creatures you will encounter on your journey. I found myself fascinated with the folklore itself, and some of the legends are truly frightening. However, the horror elements are mostly intermittent and not exceptionally scary (most of the "scary" parts I would classify more as unnerving than outright terrifying), I think this game is perfect for anyone who is new to horror games and will do a good job easing you into the genre.

However, despite my glowing recommendation, I would not recommend playing it on PC if you can get it for another device. This game was originally developed to be played on mobile devices, and while the cursor is perfectly functional, it feels a bit clunky and does not have the same seamless feel of dragging across the screen as using your finger. I would say the ideal version of the game would be the Wii U version, as it has the touch controls of the mobile version, the convenince of having the companion act on the GamePad, and is presented on a large TV to let you truly soak in the visuals. However, if you don't want to play on mobile and/or don't have a Wii U, you experience will not be significantly hampered if you choose to play it on PC. Highly recommend,

20762091.review:
Una aventura rara la que tengo hoy entre manos. Se trata de que vas para aquí y para allá por un bosque sueco donde hace más frío que el copón [i]consagrao[/i], y te vas encontrando cosas extrañas y que al parecer, están relacionadas con la mitología sueca (prometo no mencionar a Abba ni a Ikea en las [i]tontás[/i] que voy a soltar en este análisis).
Se trata de una aventura corta, y cuyos puzzles no son demasiado complicados, pero aún así, están genialmente hilados e integrados con el escenario y la interfaz de juego.
Jugaremos en primera persona, y el scroll es lateral, así que sólo nos moveremos a izquierda y derecha, peeero cuando lleguemos a ciertos lugares, una flechita nos indicará que podemos ir hacia delante o hacia atrás, pasando a un nuevo escenario con scroll lateral. Perderse es muy fácil, sobre todo si estás jugando borracho, pero para ello podemos hacer uso del... ¡Google Maps! Digo... ¡mapa! Con el mapa será facilísimo orientarse.
Como está todo más nevado que la tapa del wáter de una discoteca de la Ruta del Bakalao en 1993, los tonos del juego son fríos y algo oscuros.
El argumento del juego lo desconozco, porque iba como un misil a resolver puzzles y no me leí la documentación, pero en el menú de opciones, arriba a la derecha, tendremos texto para leer, el caso es que si no sabes inglés, mejor cógete un Super Humor del Botones Sacarino, porque no te vas a enterar. Al parecer, es un popurrí de mitología sueca con un cierto aire de terror (sí, el señor con bigote que sube el volúmen el volumen de golpe en momentos puntuales también está presente en el juego).
Lo cierto es que me divertí bastante, y los jugadores de aventuras gráficas saben que después del sexo, el primer trago de cerveza bien fría un día de verano y tirar un televisor desde una azotea, una de las mejores sensaciones que existen es encontrar una solución cuando estás atascado en un juego de estos, y con "Year Walk" tuve esa sensación. Al principio no sabrás cómo avanzar, pero de pronto, te fijas un poco, usas la lógica y darás con la solución. Por si eres un poco tontaco, tienes un sistema de pistas que, reconozco, tuve que usar en uno de los puzzles.
No creo que sea un juego que valga los 5'99€ que pide el Señor Steam, así que yo de ti, esperaría a una oferta, que seguro que las habrá, y no lo dejaría pasar.

[b]A veces, es estos juegos tan cortos, ni se graba el progreso, y hay que pasárselo del tirón.[/b] En éste no, te guarda el progreso automáticamente, así que puedes cerrarlo si tienes que salir corriendo porque tu casa va a explotar o situaciones similares.
[b]¿A qué te refieres que los puzzles están muy bien integrados?[/b] Muchas veces te darás cuenta que la respuesta que buscabas desde hace un rato, la tenías delante, sólo que "hay que fijarse".
[b]Lo he empezado a jugar, pero no sé cómo conseguir más recursos de madera y piedra para construir catapultas para proveer a mis ejércitos y asaltar la fortaleza. Es que este nivel no consigo pasármelo.[/b] Amigo mío, tú no estás jugando a "Year Walk".

It's an enchanting, worthwhile, paranormal experience that goes in unexpected directions. A bit spooky, but never scary. I wouldn't call it an "adventure game" proper (point & click) since it's so short; it's more like those artsy walking simulators but I don't mean that in a bad way. 20154650.review:
This game manages to take mythology, folklore and tales from Sweden's past and weave them into a pilgrimage of sorts with an interesting narrative with nothing more than simple puzzle mechanics. It's a lot more fun than many other games of similar ilk and it's clearly down to a lot of care and attention during development as well as a knowledge and emphasis of the lore. I found it short, quite different and refreshing and interesting to play through.

[h1]Highlights[/h1]

The things that carry Year Walk are most definitely the simple ambient design and the weaving of the story and lore into the world while staying true to the subject matter. It's carefully and smartly done and often feels as though you're part of a fairy tale or dark bedtime story as much as a video game.

[h1]Mistakes and Annoyances[/h1]

Being a port of a mobile game, it suffers from a lack of depth from the gameplay, and while the hands off approach definitely works well with the narrative and story, it's still an issue when compared against other longer, deeper titles at the same price. Having said that though, I feel like had the game been any longer it may've run the risk of adding less enjoyable puzzles for the sake of length rather than story and ultimately, while short and simple, everything is fun to experience and discover.

[h1]Recommendations[/h1]

Priced at $5.99/£4.79/4.99€ on the Steam Store at the time of review, Year Walk isn't expensive and probably isn't overpriced, but there may be better alternatives around the same price range on Steam and mobile. Due to the interesting world, atmosphere and content though, and the simple enjoyable play-through, there's no reason to avoid Year Walk and it's worth a play for anyone looking to waste an hour or so.

http://store.steampowered.com/app/269050

* [i]Note: Purely by coincidence I seem to have played Year Walk at the perfect time and picked up a free achievement for my luck. Happy New Year everyone![/i]
* Simogo, the developers of Year Walk, have a fantastic website full of Apps, Music, Art and other interactive projects. [url=http://simogo.com/]Their blog and work portfolio[/url] in particular are very worth a look.

[code]Unedited review notes 31/12/2015 for Year Walk

+Style and scares work well with the mythology and lore, even if I'm piss-scared of jumpscares
+Nicely thought out puzzles with plenty of clues
+Good staggered hints system
-Puzzles are often too easy to misinterpret or hard to spot in the world
-Puzzles often require backtracking[/code]

20150478.review:
i bought this game in April.
Saw one of the achievements : Year Walk on New Year's Eve.

flash forward 8 months

Played it again, unlocked several puzzles and got the Year Walk achievement as well.

I am so glad that I didn't write a review as soon as the first Year Walk, because I believe that the real game is actually in the second time you Year Walk. So please, Year Walk a second time and you'll appreciate this game a lot more.

The plot is fairly straightforward when you play it the first time, then when you re-play it (if you want) it will get rather confusing especially [spoiler] when you opt to open the journal and get the knife with the initials of D.S [/spoiler] . 

The graphic is minimalistic yet beautiful. Kind of eerie/melancholic, simple but consistent.

The sounds are great and well placed. When you hear nothing but the sound of your footsteps on snow, even when [spoiler] the Hudra jump-scare scene where it just screech-snapped at you after singing so beautifully [/spoiler].

Despite the short gameplay (there's even an achievement to glorify it), I personally think it's more than satisfying. This is actually the first game where I didn't wish it to be longer.

The mystery is well thought to the point where an explanation will actually ruin the whole experience, specifically [spoiler] after you open the journal and open the wooden box [/spoiler].

This is a beautiful game, the atmosphere, the music, everything is in place for a great gaming experience.

Now I'm off to Year Walk some more for the achievements.

19707590.review:
[h1]AT A GLANCE[/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*] [b]Game Name:[/b] Year Walk
[*] [b]Original Release:[/b] 2014
[*] [b]Genre Tags:[/b]; Minimalist; Puzzle; Atmospheric; Casual
[*] [b]My Overall Grade:[/b] B+
[*] [b]Estimated Playtime (Campaign):[/b] 1-3 hours
[*] [b]Multiplayer Aspect:[/b] None
[*] [b]Recommended To:[/b] Established fans of the genre; Novelty seekers; Puzzle game aficionados; Casual gamers
[/list]	

[h1]REVIEW[/h1]
[b]Year Walk[/b] is one of those abstract games that more closely resembles a piece of art than a video game.  The gameplay is extremely minimal, while the true soul of the game lies in its ambiance, art direction, and core concept.  This is the type of game which won’t appeal to everyone.  For those who appreciate the occasional artsy game with minimal gameplay, then you will probably find [b]Year Walk[/b] interesting, relaxing, and enjoyable.  If you are looking to play a traditional video game, you shouldn’t be looking here.

The gameplay is roughly 3 parts “walking-simulator” and 1 part puzzle game.  Navigating the area is your primary “challenge,” with the addition of a few puzzles you will have to solve.  The answers to these puzzles can be a bit obscure, but there is a competent hint system if you want to avoid being stuck for too long and just want to enjoy the [i]zen[/i] of the game.

The core concept of the game is also quite interesting.  [b]Year Walk[/b] is based on the Swedish folklore of [i]Årsgång[/i], which I had never heard of before playing this, and which I found to be interesting.  After learning a bit about it, I was able to see that the developers did an outstanding job bringing the idea to life in video game form, even despite its inherently simplistic design.

The art direction, soundscape, and overall ambiance of the game make for a mysterious atmosphere which is very well aligned with the core concept.  Admittedly, the graphics are quite simple; but the simple graphics fit the simple game.

Short, interesting, and atmospheric: [b]Year Walk[/b] makes for a fun little experience that is well-produced and should be easily enjoyed by anyone who truly appreciates the genre.

[i][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/murphyslawyercuration#curation]Follow my curation page to see more of my recommendations![/url][/i]

19582888.review:
[h1]短小精悍的解谜游戏[/h1]
[i]过去的人们曾经欲追寻所谓的“未来的足迹”，于是每年除夕，便有这样一群人去进行这样一项活动，即“Year Walk”。在寒冷的冬日，他们不见外人，不见火光，一天与世隔绝后，在除夕夜独自走向教堂，在神灵的庇佑下，获得种种灵视，以一瞥来年会发生的关于生死，关于爱的一切。[/i]

嗯这就是游戏的基本背景w，这是一个含有轻微恐怖元素的的解谜游戏，以一个传统的仪式为线索，通过在全图中寻找各种线索，不断推动故事的发展。故事很短，但是一周目如果眼神不好或者什么的很容易卡关，浪费大约两小时的时间，尽管游戏自带hint——但这并不会[b]过多[/b]影响游戏带来的风韵美感。

[b]请注意，英语好对理解剧情设定有很大帮助，但不是必须的！[/b]

以下正文。
[list]
[*]画面 9/10
冬日的夜晚，简约的半抽象画风，给人一种神秘而又耳目一新的美感。

[*]音效 7/10
游戏的音乐存在感非常低，略过不提。音效方面，整体较为简约而应景，个人觉得制作方还是把重点放在了内容上，游戏过程中风格还是偏安静了一点。嗯毕竟大半夜的，虽然有鬼，但hqjblkcsuhvpoaub31.

[*]操作 7/10
什么，这游戏有操作？视角一律往前看，第一人称看风景视角，鼠标交互。
[spoiler]Tip：别忘了键盘不仅仅有WASD（上下左右），你会知道为什么这么说的。[/spoiler]

[*]游戏性 9/10
游戏流程挺短的其实，但是如前文所说，作为解谜游戏，玩家可能由于眼瞎等等原因各种卡关（比如在下），然而两遍玩下来过后还是感觉难度挺恰到好处的。还能说什么呢？

[b]友情提示，内含少量高能Jump Scare，心脏病患者请回避或远离屏幕，珍爱生命，原理迷信（x）[/b]

[*]剧情 9/10
关于剧情设定我已经在开始说差不多了，想要了解更多关于Year Walk这一文化习俗及相关的传说，请参阅游戏中自带的百科全书（这也是我说英语要过关的原因）。游戏本身重在文化设定及其带来的神秘感，而不在于设定，可能不适合所有玩家食用。

[*]重玩性 7/10
一周目过了一遍过后，[b]一个成就都没有！[/b]惊呆，于是去扒了全成就指南，二周目直接全成就get，整体历时100 min左右，我应该不会继续玩三周目了，毕竟是小品向的作品，安安静静玩一遍，再爆刷一遍，也就够了。

[*]整体 8.0/10
优美的小品游戏，流程较短，解谜难度适中但可能比较线索隐晦，独特的画风与文化设定是最大吸引点，总体而言一部短小精悍的优良解谜作品。
[/list]

以上

18828659.review:
[h1]Year Walk - in 100 words:[/h1]

It begins just like a fable, but a dark one, with snow, surnatural beings and blood. In the middle of a Sweden forest, a man tries to catch a glimpse of his own future by year walking. What is it? The methods are unorthodox; the consequences are grim. In the end, nobody will survive this hubris. Fables are no more, they say. Video games killed them. Year Walk disagrees. It's an embodiment of things past that shall never be forgotten. The moral lesson will survive: some things are better left unknown. Year Walk is a reminder not to play God.

[h1]Year Walk is...[/h1]

...a game with a strong atmosphere and a gloomy mood. Jumpscares may occur, so be warned.
...forcing you to play at least twice to begin understanding the whole thing.
...relatively easy on the puzzle, and does not require a PhD in Braid-o-phily.

[h1]Year Walk is not...[/h1]

...a fast-paced game with guns and explosions. Everything is slow, even the walking.
...long enough. In fact, it is very short. Know what you are getting into before buying it.
...for those who hate reading and connecting the dots by themselves.

18718515.review:
This is my review of Year Walk.

Well, what a game that was. Or maybe it shouldn't be called a game. Instead, an experience in solitude. I had owned this game for over a year before finally playing it, and I can't lie, I’m kind of annoyed I waited that long. Me and My Associate decided to go through all of the games that I have not played in my Steam Library and this was one of them. 

I had no idea what to expect when we started up the game. I was pleasantly surprised by how much we enjoyed it. This game is an Exploration Puzzle game with odd navigation controls. You soon get used to it and the game becomes a blast. You navigate across 2D planes in first person and hop between layers of the world. First of all, the sound design is peng. The crispyty crunch of the noise of snow under your feet is a very nice and subtle choice and puts you right in the Snowy Swedish Wilderness. The art style was reminiscent of "Fosters Home for Imaginary Kids" and really suited the shifting tone of Wonder and Dread (Not the Judge). The story is difficult to explain and should be experienced first-hand with all the pieces of the puzzle aligning to make a beautiful mosaic of Swedish folklore. I would valiantly recommend giving this Modern Masterpiece a couple of hours of your time.

Remember Dear Readers, You heard it here first. Off the record, On the QT, and very Hush-Hush.

It's a good reminder that a game need not be lengthy in order for it to be great and it was a great game to play late at night just before Halloween.

Сюжет ; в былие времена люди живущие в Скандинавских лесах , которые хотели узнать свое будущее  , за день до большого праздника закрывались в темном уголке своего дома и находились там целый день без еды и питья  . Притягательная прогулка, которая вполне может поглотить душу и рассудок. Просто, но одновременно удивительно емко и печально рассказанная история о том, что будущее стоит держать за старыми ржавыми воротами кладбища.

Полуночный лес, таящий в себе ужасы истерзанного сознания. Правда ли увиденное... или вымысел в попытке оправдать действия других людей? Ответ даст сама игра, которая вцепится в ваше сердце мертвой хваткой и проведет через заколдованную лесную чащобу. Но с ней нужно быть настороже... иначе велик риск вероятности, что не полюбите ее при первом брошенном на местный снег взгляде.

Если говорить не загадками, а прямолинейно, то Year Walk вышла воистину атмосферной, странной и очень-очень личной игрой. Проводя время за исследованием местных территорий и решением ребусов, не стоит отвлекаться - такие вещи поглощаются единовременно, в один присест. А если вам уж точно по душе неординарные проекты, то "Прогулка года" определенно станет вашим личным переживанием.

Мистицизм, колдовство, легенды "старой" Швеции. И просто завораживающая музыка, которую я вам настоятельно рекомендую для прослушивания.

18410283.review:
This is a desolate, surreal walking simulator adventure game with jump scares and ARG elements. Its tone is both wondrous and depressing, dictated very firmly by the Scandinavian folklore on which the game heavily leans. The game uses all the tools at its disposal rather impressively, creating auditory puzzles as well as visual ones and hiding relevant information in plain sight. Unfortunately, this may make some puzzles come off as obtuse and force people to look up solutions outside of the game proper.

I'm giving this game a "thumbs up" despite the fact that I don't want to play it again. True to the folklore that inspired the game, there is no happy ending to be found in it. From the perspective of someone who appreciates game-world lore consistency, I love this, but it still does not compel me to replay the game (for achievements or otherwise).

Personally, I find the experience to be worth the full admission price, despite the tone. You may disagree, but I still recommend picking this game up while it's on sale.

18029406.review:
Year Walk is definitedly one of the best, most thrilling, atmospheric short indie games I ever played since quite a long time. The graphics and soundtrack are really amazing and fascinating through a stunning kind of minimalism which holds a very gloomy charm on itself. Some of the riddles are quite tricky but you'll always find some useful hints in the menue to help you through. The story builds up slowly as you play,  explore and walk through a silent, odd winter landscape, leading you  to a most unexpected creepy discovery in the very end.  It ain't look great on first sight but you might change your mind when reaching and finding out the "true" story end of this Year Walk.

I've always been fascinated by Northern cultures and their dark and strange fairytales so I was very happy to finally get a chance to dive into this hunting, confusing part of an old Swedish folklore custom. Well done!

18023343.review:
Year Walk is beautiful.

The graphics are stunning and simple at the same time, the minimal palette of colors that makes the game very atmospheric almost makes you feel like you're the one year walking in the middle of the night, chilled the the bone. The game looks like its made out of paper, like its a pop-up book, and it really heightens the creepy factor for me.

The soundtrack is very atmospheric and subtle, and the melodies are haunting. Usually, I get bored by a game's soundtrack halfway through, but I really enjoyed Year Walk's.

The only disappointing thing would have been the ending. At first i was pleasantly surprised by the originality of th ending, which did something i never actually saw anywhere else, but the very end kind of fell short. Still, i had very high expectations of the ending because of the rest of the game, so i dont think i would have been satisfied with pretty much anything.

If you're debating whether getting this game or not, get it. Its relatively cheap and you can get a good five hours of gameplay from this indie jewel. There's some replay potential, if you really want to get immersed in the story like i did.

All around, i would give this game a 8.5 out of 10, for the graphics, the soundtrack, the story and the originality, but i  had to take out some points for the ending that wasnt really as good as the game itself.

17978095.review:
Year Walk is based on Swedish lore about vision quests. You embark on a long walk in the woods, looking for signs and meanings, and you come across some very strange stuff. There's a very dreamlike quality to the game where the odd glyph or ghost you run into feels almost expected, but it also serves to take you out of the real world and immerse you with very simple, beautiful graphics. This makes the horrifying bits all the more effective, because they come in rough contrast to the feel of the rest of the game. I won't lie, there have been a few jump scares, but the feel earned instead of cheap. It's like a nightmare intruding on the edges of a pastoral dream.

Gameplay is simple, moving left or right through pretty landscapes, moving forward or backward to different areas, and clicking on things to interact. You have a useful map and an encyclopedia that helps flesh out the legends and signs you encounter. The game also has a very clever way of getting you to use the encyclopedia later on, which I found very effective. The puzzles are pretty simple as well, so don't go in expecting a lot of gameplay. It's mostly exploring the woods and delving into the myths you encounter, which for the price, I think is well worth it. An entertaining, chilling experience.

17667466.review:
Year Walk is a very interesting Adventure horror game. But will you want to play it ?

Year Walk story is really hard to explain. You play as a man trying to do a year walk on New year's eve. It's based on Swedish mythology. It's one of those games where you piece the story together when you play it. 

Gameplay is really simple. You use the keyboard to move around and the mouse to click on stuff and the goals vary on the cycle you're on. It can range from trying to find ghost to trying to find a way to a church. 

The art style is amazing to say the least. The hand drawn environments and characters are really amazing to look at. The style is really well drawn. 

Audio is amazing. The soundtrack and sound effects are both really well made. It makes you feel tense and relaxed. It really makes you immersed in the world. 

The game isn't difficult. Some of the puzzles are difficult but nothing too head scratching. The game gives you clues  and even then you have hints which are helpful. 

The map layout is the only bad thing about this game. It get's confusing really fast and it doesn't help when all environments look the same. I wish they could have given more indication where you need to go.

Game is really short. It took me 1 hour to finish it. There is an alternative ending which can be unlocked, but overall don't expect much replay value. 

The game didn't have bugs what so ever. Any rig could handle this game. Don't expect to run into bugs while playing this game.

Year walk is a really tough game to review and to explain why you need to play it is even tougher, but you must play it no matter what. Year Walk was an amazing experience and the whole lore behind it is really interesting. Adventure game fans must own this little title as soon as possible. It's worth it at full price without a doubt. I give Year Walk a 8.5/10

For more reviews follow Snort's Review curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/snortsreviews#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

[b]For those unaware - this is essentially a  point-and-click adventure with dark, abstract overtones.[/b] You meddle around the woods and solve riddles/puzzles. [b]If you are thinking about purchasing this, I would consider getting it on your mobile device instead because it would be easier to play laying in bed or really wherever you want since there is no advantage of having it on your computer.[/b]

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Puzzles are way too abstract in how you solve them - I think I even looked some of them up in the later game. I wouldn't even recommend this on a sale.

17449419.review:
Det finns många gamla seder i Sverige. En som jag ända tills nyligen var helt ovetande om är den så kallade årsgången. En årsgång var en nattlig vandring då man fick reda på händelser som skulle komma att inträffa det kommande året. Årsgången kunde bara ske vissa speciella nätter, såsom framför allt nyårsnatten, och den avslutades alltid vid socknens kyrka.

I spelet Year Walk genomför man en årsgång. Till att börja med avråds man från att genomföra vandringen – det kan ju vara farligt att veta för mycket om framtiden – men naturligtvis ger man sig ut ändå. Under vandringens gång får man möta flera skrämmande skogsväsen, tvingas klura ut en del problem och pulsa i en hel del snö.

Jag tycker det är skönt att man i Year Walk slipper möta de vanliga småtrista fantasivarelserna (alver, gobliner, satyrer, osv) som finns med i alltför många spel. I stället möter man de verkliga invånarna i skogen, som exempelvis Skogsrået och Bäckahästen. Det är också skönt att spela i en miljö som känns nästan som skogen hemmavid, fast för sådär en hundrafemtio år sedan. Spelets atmosfär är krypande obehaglig, med riktigt lyckad blandning av stämningsmusik och smygande ljudeffekter. Vid flera tillfällen under spelets gång hann jag faktiskt bli ordentligt rädd, både av stämningen och av en del för mig oväntade vändningar.

Rent tekniskt så är spelet lite träigt. Man vandrar mest i sidled genom landskapet och det kan vara lite svårt att hitta rätt. Det finns en karta att tillgå men den möjligheten missade jag eftersom jag på något sätt inte sett spelmenyn. Det gjorde att jag också missade att man kan få ledtrådar till de till viss del ganska svåra problemen man måste lösa för att komma vidare. Det gjorde att jag fastnade från och till, men tack vare rätt stor erfarenhet av problemlösning kunde jag hela tiden lista ut vad jag skulle göra, även om jag tog riktigt lång tid på mig för att göra det ibland.

Spelet lever mycket på den närmast perfekta stämningen i både ljud och bild, men även historien är värd uppmärksamhet. Framför allt fram emot slutet, och slutet av spelet har man nått först när man får se “The end”.

Sedan kommer Kyrkogrimmen och hemsöker mina drömmar.

([b]It seems that the Steam profanity filter does not like the Swedish word for "end", which is just ridiculous in a text like this one, ie which is flagged as being in Swedish.[/b])

호러 어드밴처 게임입니다.

17268412.review: Let me start off the bat and let ya'll know that I'm a chicken shit when it comes to horror games. No matter how bright the room is, how low the music or whether I'm not alone, it's almost near impossible for me to play this genre from start to finish. But, my oh my, even though it felt at times my heart was going to burst through my chest (thanks to the awesomely haunting sound effects and music!) I couldn't stop playing. This game is fascinating! Early on I caught on that I should be writing down the cryptic signs sprinkled across the landscape to help me progress and that enriched my gameplay experience even further. I felt totally engrossed scribbling in my notebook like a mad man. When you finish your first year walk it becomes apparent that your journey is just beginning. Everything about this game is just beautiful. I can't recommend this game enough, especially to all the scaredy cats out there, it's worth the experience!

17087262.review:
Öncelikle oyun hakkında bilgi vererek başlamak istiyorum. Bu oyun İsveç folklorundaki Årsgång denen olayı temel alıyor. Nedir bu diye araştırdım, internette bu olay hakkında çok fazla olmasa da bir kaç şey buldum, bulduklarımı da aktarmaya çalışacağım. Årsgång (Year Walk) olarak çevrilmiş. Ben Årsgång diyeceğim. Årsgång'ın hakkında çok kesin bir bilgi yok çünkü İsveçin aynı bölgelerinden bile çok farklı tanımlar çıkmış, o yüzden anladığımı anlatayım.

Årsgång genellikle İsveç'in güneyinde, 1800'lerin başlarına kadar yapılıyormuş. Geleneğe göre Noel'de veya Yeni yıl zamanında Småland ve Blekinge bölgelerinde, Walker(Yürüyen) denilen kişiler hiçbir şey yiyip içmeden, veya konuşmadan, kendilerini kış vakti karanlık bir odaya kilitliyorlar. Geceyarısı olduğunda bölgedeki kilisenin veya kiliselerin etrafında 3 (veya daha fazla) kere dolaşıyorlar. Daha sonra kilisenin anahtar deliğine üflüyorlar. Böylece geçici bir süre hristiyanlıktan çıkmış oluyorlar. Bunu yaptıktan sonra doğaüstü varlıklar ortaya çıkıyor ve Walker'la uğraşmaya başlıyorlar. Eğer Walker bu testleri geçmeyi başarabilirse, geleceğinden bir anı, bir ses veya bir görüntüyle ödüllendirileceğine inanıyorlar.

Walker'ların bu süre zarfında ateşin ışığını görmemiş olmaları gerekiyor. Walker ayrıca ciddiyetini göstermek için de oruç tutuyor. Bir ziyaretçi geldiğinde de onunlar selamlaşmıyor, konuşmuyor veyahutta gülmüyor. Eğer Walker'ın gördüğü şeyler bir mezarlıktaki mezarlarsa; felaketin geleceği, ellerinde demetler taşıyan küçük insanlarsa (elfler veya cüceler); iyi bir hasat bekleneceği, ağaca kazınmış bir insan sureti veya atlı, zırhlı askerler ise; savaşın geleceğine işaret ediyor.

Genel bir inanışa göre eğer bir Walker 7 yıl boyunca bu yolda yürümüşse, son gecesinde, üstü zırhlı, ağzında runkavle (çok araştırdım pek birşey bulamadım, korku verici bir varlık veya bir olgu olduğunu düşünüyorum) bulunan bir adamla karşılaşır ve eğer Walker bunu koparıp alacak kadar güçlü ve cesur birisiyse, bu kişi bilgeliğe ulaşır. Gizli şeyler hakkında bilgi sahibi olur ve bir daha Årsgång'a çıkmadan geleceği daimi görebilir.

[b] Oyun	[/b]

Şimdi oyuna giriş yapacak olursak, ben açıkçası 1-2 bölüm geçene kadar araştırmamıştım olayı. Oyundan okuduğum kadarıyla yetinmiştim. Sonrasında okuyup anlayınca oyunu daha farklı oynadım. Ki olayı bildiğiniz için, olacakları da biraz tahmin edebilirsiniz. Puzzle'ları gerçekten çok zor, rehbersiz bitirirseniz valla helal olsun. Atmosferi çok güzel ve gerilimli. Hatta bi kaç yerde gerçekten korktum (öyle böyle değil, elim ayağım boşaldı resmen, 5 dk ara verdim :D belki sizde aynı etkiyi yaratmayabilir, ben çok tırsarım). Oyun için aslında tam olarak korkunç değil de "Creepy" demek daha mantıklı bence. Sesleri harika, gayet kendinizi ormanda yürüyormuş gibi hissedebilirsiniz. Hatta bunu yaz aylarında sırf kar'ın ayaklarınız altındaki gırç sesini duymak için oynasanız bile olur :D Modellemeler ve çizimler tam benim zevkime göreydi. Renklendirmeler ve efektler gayet hoştu. Sonuç olarak farklı bir oyun, farklı bir atmosfer, biraz tırsmak, biraz da olayın akışına kaptırmak istiyorsanız kendinizi, bu oyunu alabilirsiniz. 

Edit: Oyunu bitirmiş olmanız oyunu tamamladığınız anlamına gelmiyor. Bir kaç kere daha deneyin. Not alarak ilerleyin.

İpucu: Orada kilitli bir kutu vardı hatırlarsanız? Hikayenin diğer yüzünü öğrenmeniz için o kutuyu açmanızı şiddetle tavsiye ederim.

16770322.review:
This is one of those times that I wish Steam had a numerical rating system instead of just "yes/no".

I wouldn't go so far as to say I don't recommend Year Walk.  It has a unique visual style, and there are no glaring flaws in the game.  However, after hearing it praised by so many reviewers, I was very disappointed when I finally got around to playing it.

It isn't exactly a [i]bad[/i] game, but it's nowhere near as impressive as its current "94% positive" rating might lead you to believe.  I'd give the game 7/10 at best.  Aside from the art and atmoshperic soundtrack, the game is rather bland.  It's just point and click with puzzles.  Not exactly a rare treat.

I think I would have enjoyed it more if there had been more story and character development.  Year Walk provides the bare minimum in these areas.  Since I knew so little about the character I was playing, I simply wasn't invested enopugh to be scared - or emotionally affected in way at all, really.  For me, Year Walk was just a series of spooky pictures.  And that's simply not enough to make a great game, even if those pictures are well done,

16499722.review:
Year Walk es un juego dificil de definir, a primera vista, parece un aventura grafica de flash de esas de minijuegos.com, me recuerda a aquellas tardes en la oficina de mi madre, en las que se me permitia jugar al ordenador despúes de hacer los deberes y me pasaba horas en esa pagina buscando un juego con dibujos chulos o violento.  Pero el juego esconde mucho más, su jugabilidad es sencilla(es un juego de android), puedes andar por un paramo nevado y buscar cosas para tocar, algo asi como un SuperBrothers en primera persona. Y el juego al igual que Superbrothers es jodidamente bonito, esta basado en un mito de la  cultura escandinava y nuestra mision es la de embancarnos en un exodo o rito de madurez por un bosque nevado en busca de algo. Y el juego no explica más, nos deja descubrir el bosque y perdernos por el y poco más. 
 
Es un juego de terror, pero es un terror bello, bien hecho, muy bien contrastado con el mundo, además es corto, si no te pierdes(como yo) en 30 minutos 1 hora puedes acabarlo, y tampoco tiene mucha rejugabilidad, solo consiste en resolver puzzles, con cierta gracia la verdad, los hay de exploracion, musicales, de observar y de tocar. Espero volver a darle otra vuelta al juego pronto, pero me dejo tan buen sabor de boca al acabarlo, es de esos juegos de darle vueltas al final, a su pequeño mundo, a explorar más su trasfondo. Sencillo, en cierto grado profundo y hermoso.

Quizas luego lo veais y digais que bullshit es esta, pero a mi me llego bastante al fondo.

El mito en el que esta basado es el Årsgång

16489020.review: Great little adventure(?) game with more replayablity than one would think. It is short enough to play in a night, but it will pull you in.

16483369.review:
Pueden ver esta reseña y un longplay del juego en video aquí: http://www.ociotakus.com/year-walk-resena-y-longplay/
O pueden leer esta reseña en mi blog: http://www.agustinfest.com/2015/06/year-walk-resena/

Year Walk es una novela visual, una aventura de apuntar y dar click (point and click adventure). Lo produjo y desarrolló SIMOGO el 2013 y pueden comprarlo en STEAM para PC o MAC o pueden comprarlo para iOS. Supongo que está disponible tanto para iPhone como para iPad. La versión de PC incluye algunos acertijos y logros adicionales. Cuesta 66 varitos mexicanos.

El juego trata de un viejo ritual sueco que se hace en la noche vieja. Se supone que si sigues los pasos, puedes hacer una pregunta a extraños seres sobrenaturales y ellos te dirán el futuro. No puedo decir mucho más de la historia porque depende muchísimo de ella. Cualquier cosita es un spoiler y el juego depende tanto de la sorpresa, para sus dos finales, que si no tengo cuidado y doy uno que otro detalle, la experiencia del juego está peligrosamente cerca de romperse.

Puedo contar un poco del inicio: tú juegas el papel de Daniel Svensson quien visita a su amada para preguntarle qué onda, si van a andar o van a seguir escondiéndose, pero la amada le dice que todavía no sabe si irse con Daniel o con su novio, el que sí tiene dinero.

Daniel decide hacer el Year Walk para saber con quién se queda su amada en el futuro.

Ya que no podemos decir más de la historia, hablemos del juego en sí: para completar el Year Walk tienes que enfrentarte a los acertijos de espíritus muy extraños. El diseño de dichos espíritus es buenísimo y aunque puede verse demasiado sencillo, logra involucrarte dentro de la historia y del folclor que existe dentro del juego. Los fondos y los escenarios están bellamente detallados. Las transiciones y los movimientos de animación, entre las pantallas, tienen su chiste y también ayudan a la experiencia general del juego.

La música y el sonido también son muy buenos. El juego como un todo: ilustración, sonido, música es un trabajo lleno de amor y de muchísimo detalle. Basta con jugarlo un poco para entender la entrega de los desarrolladores. Desde el inicio que, de alguna manera, despierta sensaciones adolescentes, cuando todo era perfecto; no sólo se revive la ilusión del primer amor, o de los primeros deseos, sino como estos pueden pervertirse o degenerarse. Parece que siempre estamos al acecho de criaturas oscuras, de animales sobrenaturales, que están dispuestos a robarse nuestra alma por una duda, por conocer el futuro, por saber si nuestro destino es lo que siempre estuvimos esperando. Y no lo duden, porque el juego presenta estas pequeñas sorpresas: fantasmas, niños muertos, abominaciones terribles.

Algunos dicen que el juego es de terror aunque no lo creo. Tiene sus desagradables sorpresas pero, más bien, sigue siendo una historia especulativa, de fantasía, que juega entre muchos géneros: no sólo el terror, sino con la ciencia ficción, los viajes en el tiempo y la importancia de conservar la historia y las tradiciones. A veces, incluso, el juego se pone un poquito modernista.

Pero hablemos más de la narrativa del juego: a pesar de que está bien trabajado, y que muchas cosas las controla minuciosamente, deja mucho que desear por el lado narrativo. La calidad es variable por esa parte, ya que en algunos escenarios debemos leer y leer cantidades ridículas de información para entender y pasar algunos acertijos.

No digo que la lectura esté mal, al fin y al cabo Year Walk se trata de una novela visual, pero al final pusieron menos empeño en esta parte y se nota porque a veces el tono se rompe con uno que otro cliché, lugar común o una sobresimplificación de la historia. Lo cual es un poco triste porque el juego está ampliamente trabajado en las demás aristas y pienso que pudo ser mejor. Quizás sea una cuestión de traducción del sueco al inglés, quizás. No lo sé.

Si juegan con guía, la experiencia del juego se reduce a unas dos o tres horas, máximo. Si lo juegan sin guía, y se atreven a pasar los acertijos sin ayuda, quizás aumente a unas 8 ó 10 horas. Los acertijos están difíciles. El juego consta de dos finales. El segundo final es un acertijo que no puede resolverse hasta que terminas el juego la primera vez y es el final real, por decirlo así.

¿Recomiendo Year Walking? Sí, en conjunto es una gran experiencia. Lo recomiendo, especialmente, para gamers que disfrutan los acertijos, las novelas visuales, los point and click y los sustos ocasionales. Para los amantes del terror y de la fantasía, esta puede ser una buena alternativa. No recomiendo el juego si te gustan los disparos, si desprecias la lectura o si te chocan las adivinanzas difíciles. Muchos de los acertijos salen de lo convencional y exigen del jugador un poco de… creatividad. Eso es todo lo que tengo que decir de Year Walk, recuerden que lo pueden conseguir en STEAM por 65 pesitos o bien, pueden conseguirlo en el app store, aunque la versión de STEAM tiene algunas cosas añadidas que mejoraron un poco la experiencia.

16359810.review:
Year Walk è un'avventura in prima persona a scorrimento, in cui ci si muove attraverso degli scenari bidimensionali. In primo luogo colpisce per lo stile grafico, poi ci si lascia trasportare dagli eventi misteriosi.
E' un gioco cupo, triste, inquietante ed in certi punti terribile.
Ci sono delle descrizioni da leggere prima di cominciare, perché è giusto conoscere alcune leggende popolari svedesi e le creature che ne fanno parte. E' in inglese, ma non c'è molto da leggere, perché c'è tanto silenzio. E le neve, che è ugualmente silenziosa.
Year Walk è una camminata che si pratica soltanto in alcuni periodi dell'anno, in particolar modo il 31 dicembre, l'ultimo giorno dell'anno. Chi decide di intraprenderla, lo fa per conoscere il proprio futuro. Ma non è semplice e può risultare pericolosa, perché gli incontri che si potrebbero avere nel corso dell'avventura possono disturbare il nostro animo.
Nel 19° secolo c'è stato qualcuno che ha praticato questa tecnica, ma ormai nessuno la conosce più.
In questa avventura si conoscerà il vero significato di "Year Walk", quali sono le paure e le ossessioni che spingono una persona a compiere un viaggio così breve e così disturbante allo stesso tempo.
E' un viaggio che lascia qualcosa dentro, non si torna più indietro come prima.

16193889.review:
Who doesn't love a dark, snowy forest possibly haunted by old gods and deadly secrets? I'd suggest that the first time you play through Year Walk it is during the day in a well lit room - I made the mistake of installing a playing it at 2 in the morning in an empty house.

Anyway, Year Walk is one of those games that I had never heard of and probably never would have played had it not been part of a Humble Bundle a while back. Thank goodness for that, because I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. A relatively quick game to play through, the puzzles range from simple to rather difficult (and I love puzzles). The audio and visual design of the game is both haunting and starkly beautiful, and I loved learning a bit more about Scandinavian folklore. Overall most definitely worth the time!

16136278.review:
"Year Walk" is an interesting game. It has unique mythology and a simple concept that is quite endearing. 

This is a puzzle game. I will be the first to admit that I'm not very good at these types of games, even  though I enjoy playing them. While the puzzles are, for the most part, very well thought out and interesting, they are not very difficult. This is not a game for a serious puzzle solver as I believe they will get bored rather quickly. There were only two puzzles that I found difficult: one being merely time consuming and the second being one that I actually had to look up. The solution was outrageous. 

The only other complaint that I have would be that I believe that this game would have benefited by being longer. The entire game can be beaten by an amateur puzzle solver like me in little more than an hour. That did disappoint me. 

That being said, I still really enjoyed playing "Year Walk" and would recommend it to others.

15970529.review: This is such a great game, I really have no complaints about it. Perhaps only that I wish there was more, because of how great it is. Folklore from around the world has to be one of my most favourite things to find in a game, and this game really includes it well. I would love to play more games that involve the folklore and tales. It's not an obviously scary game, it's that creeping scare that builds as you play through the story. You slowly start to feel that paranoid itch that needs scratching, that feeling that something is wrong but you can't place it until something happens. It's beautiful and haunting in it's own way, and I can honestly say that I haven't enjoyed a game as much as this in quite awhile.

15939526.review:
Year Walk is a short game, being the shortness one of the strong points, where every minute of it (including replay minutes) is worthy. 

The music and the simple art fits perfectly with the creepy (without, despite of scare-jumps, reaching the horror genre) and surreal atmosphere. I loved the little walk for the scandinavian folklore being a total ignorant of it, especially during the immersive reading of the journal. Yes, the journal ;)

15924083.review: I really like the developer and him making this game delving into a real topic in Nordic history. The game did have a few jump scares, although for the most part I did not find the game to have a scary atmosphere, until after playing the game the second time through to get the final ending. I liked the story and found my self interested in it, more so in the second walk. I do think the mechanics weren't very good. The puzzle with the  box was clever and inventive. But the rest of the puzzles sucked. They were usually super ambiguous, and many people needed to use walkthroughs and help such as myself because you were supposed to write down all these different symbols in random places, and if you missed one you couldn't solve it. You didn't know when to use what, and one even made you use a keyboard to solve which hadnt been implemented before the entire game. Also I didn't like navigating, as it felt kind of sloppy with all of the linear paths you had to find. The game had no direction either, and you never knew which one of the 15 spots to go to next. If I hadn't used a walkthrough I would have wandered around a lot, as the game wants you to, but I find that dumb and artificially inflating the game. Some people love how "existential" the game is and how smart that makes them feel, but I just thought there could have been more direction. Overall it was poor gameplay, with an interesting twist with the second playthrough, and a story that picks up. Better, more interesting gameplay with direction and puzzles that make sense, and this game would have been a recommend. 5.5/10.

15918504.review: A creative endeavour that very much deserves to be played. It requires you to put some effort in like taking notes and it has a great atmosphere. It's fun to read the lore and let your mind drift while playing. A most worthy break which doesn't outstay it's welcome.

15905788.review:
Year Walk ist ein Spiel, wie es leider zu Wenige gibt.

Gameplay: Man merkt, dass das Spiel für Tablets/Smartphones mit konzipiert wurde. Es gibt nur Mausklick,W,A,S,D und nur an einer Stelle muss man einen bestimmtes Objekt wirklich anklicken. Die Rätsel sind relativ einfach gehalten, nur muss man erst einmal herausfinden, wo man hin muss. Hier spielt das Spiel viel mit Musik und Soundtracks. Übrigens sehr gelungen. Leider ist das Spiel recht kurz geraten, aber es lässt sich auch nochmal ein weiteres Mal spielen und etwas Neues entdecken. Das Spiel setzt auf die Musik und die Atmossphäre um zu beeindrucken. Nur ganz wenige Male gibt es so etwas wie einen "Schockmoment". Ansonsten fand ich es auch positiv, dass man gezwungen ist, sich ein wenig über schwedische Mysterien weiterzubilden.

Grafik: Naja nicht viel zu ergänzen, die Grafik ist sehr schlicht gehalten. Das ist aber mit Absicht geschehen und gliedert sich super in das Spiel ein. Dieser gezeichnete Spielstil war meiner Meinung nach sehr treffend gewählt.

Fazit:
Eine sehr kurze Spielzeit, aber sehr gefühlvoll und mit einer guten Story dahinter. Man blickt nen bisschen in ne andere Kultur hinein und die Musik ist wirklich sehr schön, wenn man es mal etwas ruhiger mag. Daher ist Year Walk ein sehr schönes Spiel und ich kann es wirklich empfehlen :)

15465963.review:
Molto carino.
Year Walk è un avventura grafica con alcuni puzzle ed enigmi. Molto corto, la prima run vi durerà un oretta e mezza, due, se vi metterete a leggere tutto il diario e risolverete, senza video o gameplay vari, i vari enigmi anche in maniera molto blanda e lenta. La storia è molto bella, devo dire mi ha molto emozionato e per i romanticoni come me devo dire che il finale è ad effetto. La comprensione di ciò che dovrebbe fare il pratognista... da brividi. 
Lo Year Walk è una sorta di viaggio fisico-mentale che si fa per avere visioni sulla vita presente e futura ( un viaggio droghereccio direi ) e appunto andando in giro il protagonista troverà questi esseri presi dalla mitologia norvegese e avra visioni creepy ed horror in questo villaggio colmo di neve.
Riassumendo si può dire che i punti negativi sono:
- la poca longevità del gioco: in 3 ore di gioco avrete completato il gioco più volte e platinato anche, uno degli achivements è finire il gioco in 20 minuti, questo per far capire quanto è corto.
- Essendo un avventura grafica e quindi un gioco con un itenerario prefissato avendolo giocato una volta, rigiocarlo perderà il gusto.
- Sfida poco ardua: questò può essere negativo o positivo dipende per cosa si prende il gioco se per rilassarsi o per trovare nuove sfide

Lati positivi:
- La storia: è semplicemente bella, devo dire che ormai ci sono pochi giochi che mi danno quel brivido dietro la schiena, che mi fanno urlare NOOOOO o SI, non perchè sono sopravvissuto ad un boss o droppato qualcosa di buono ma semplicemente per la trama, perchè mi immedessimo nel personaggio e vivendo la sua storia riesco a gioire o soffrire di ciò che accade. Beh Year Walk ci è riuscito.
- Il gameplay è buono molti enigmi sono facili anche troppo ma è buono per rilassarsi e per vivere una storia come se fosse un buon libro.
- La colonna sonora l ho trovata azzeccata specialmente la canzone principale "oh the Joy"
- Il doppio finale da brivido: e su questo non dico nulla

In finale un bel gioco, appassionante e rilassante. Lo consiglio, se siete incerti addatelo alla wishlist e magari aspettate un saldo :)

15456757.review:
I think that anyone who wants to play Year Walk should know some thing beforehand:
-It's short, but it's worth every minute.
-It's spooky and features many jump-scares. So be mentally prepared for those.
-It's well researched and makes you learn a lot about Scandinavian folklore. It's perfect for anyone with interest in these kind of topics.
-There's two endings, one after you've "completed the game", and that second one is AMAZING!
-You'll read a lot. But don't worry, it's not novel-length text.
-You thought you weren't afraid of horses? You were wrong!
-You thought you can't feel chills in a pretty, sunny landscape? Also wrong!
-You thought being a researcher for a videogame is an easy job? Nope!
-You know where I am going with this. This game is amazing! It's spooky but you will not regret it one bit.

15452799.review:
Year Walk is a great game that is well worth it's price.  Though the game is short, it is packed full of content and you'll be entertained from start to finish.  The game mechanics are simple and the puzzles are challenging but not irritatingly so.

Where this game really shines is the incredible atmosphere.  Few games that  I have played have really drawn me into their world the way that this one has.  The scenery and the music work together in a way that make you truly feel the game as you play it.  I honestly felt that  I was wandering through a supernatural forest seeking answers to questions that only the spirits knew.  Don't even get me started on how eerily creepy the game was, especially since when  I first started playing I hadn't been aware that it was a horror game.  Your second time through the game only adds to this as you learn A LOT about the events of the game through a second individual's eyes. 

If you're looking for an atmospheric, creepy puzzle game with a deep storyline, look no further.  Year Walk is worth a playthrough!

15363179.review:
This is going to be a short review, for a short game.

A curious adventure (not quite point-and-click, but similar) game, where you embark upon a Year Walk. In old Swedish culture, one who wanted to know their fortune in the future, be it in love, money, luck or longevity, stuck themselves in a pitch black room for 12 hours on an important calendar day (such as May Day, New Years Eve, Star Wars Day, or Talk Like a Pirate Day, that sort of thing) and emerged at midnight, they went on a walk around their local area, whereupon ghosts and spirits would appear upon their travels, with various meanings and motives. Their final destination would be a local church, where upon they would face their demons and have their fate told.

"Year Walk" explores these travels in regards to a character's love life, and shares snippets of encyclopaedic knowledge of the Year Walk ritual. Have a maze of scenes that have the construct and aesthetic of illustrated lateral dioramas made of flattened layers. You move between, as you stumble around looking for spirits who will progress your journey.
Year Walk is roughly only an hour long, though the puzzles are a little tricky, there are very few of them, and the map is not overly large. However, the game warrants two play-throughs to experience the whole story.

It's a curiosity of a game. Its creepy and unnerving. Informative and narratively interesting. It’s hard not to recommend for its unique approach alone. My only bug bear is that the asking price (about £5) is probably more than I would normally expect to pay for a game of this length, but then again I'm a stingy bastard who got this game in a bundle...

15355054.review: Amazing game with great visuals, a bit short but has some great puzzels, my only problem was the couple of jumpscares.

15338781.review:
In terms of concept, this game is aimed at people who appreciate the darker side of folk heritage. Being based on Swedish folklore that intertwines with a personal drama and a musing on time & space continuum (it's actually less pretentious than it sounds), it offers a haunting and rewarding playing experience.
The soundtrack is excellent (kudos to Mr Daniel Olsén) and the graphics are good enough for this type of game.  The game features one of the most interesting lore pages and in-game diaries I have had the opportunity to read.

Gameplay-wise, it is an atmospheric combo of the point and click, adventure and horror genres. I have expected a more disjointed experience, but its strong concept keeps the strings of the gameplay together.

From a purely technical point of view, the game still feels like a port from a mobile device, but, to its credit, it handles the job rather well.

Overall, a solid one!

8.5/10

15311502.review:
This is, yet again, another game that I could talk for about an hour about; not because of how amazing it is, but because of the strange circumstance I find myself in. I enjoyed this game, more or less. I cannot, however, recommend this game. 

Year Walk is short. Very short. You may think you know what I mean by that, but you dont. No game Ive ever played has been this short. Should the puzzles prove intuitive to you (hint: they wont) you could theoretically beat this game in about ten minutes. 'But wait!' you say ' the same could be said of Myst, and that game is amazing'.  The difference in this case is that Year Walk just isnt that good. It is, in essence, a primer on the concept of a Year Walk (the scandanavian tradition of, as far as I can tell, fasting yourself delusional then wandering around until you can see the future) and the sorts of critters and monster's you're likely to encounter on such a journey.  In basic point of fact, Year Walk is a bad puzzle game, with most of its puzzles revolving around draging things around the environment in ways you wouldnt normally assume possible. That, combined with the jump-scare horror and the fairly short runtime, makes this game fall short of a recommendation.

HOWEVER. If you have a massive boner for any sort of mythology, and want to spend 20 minutes reading the game's codex, then a walkthough for the game, its not half bad. The real sticker is the price; there are much better things to be had both real and virtual for $5.

15065868.review:
Szczerze mówiąc: nie wierzyłem w to. Nie wierzyłem, iż w dzisiejszych czasach może powstać gra, która powoduje u mnie jeżenie się skóry klimatem a nie jumpscare'ami. Świetna fabuła, przepięka, minimalistyczna grafika i wziągająca muzyka. Właśnie takiego zestawienia szukałem już od x czasu. Ale od początku.

Gdy ciemność ogarnie wszystko dookoła, w ostatni dzień roku mogą stać się rzeczy, których się nie spodziewamy. Nadnaturalne. To jedyny czas w roku, kiedy ma się możliwość poznania prawdy na najbardziej nurtujące pytanie. Aby odkryć tajemnicę trzeba udać się na wędrówkę. Na year walk...

Year Walk jest grą opracowaną przez studio Simogo i wyszło początkowo na platformy mobilne, a konkretniej urządzenia z systemem iOS. W tytule wcielamy się w młodego mężczyznę z XIX wiecznej Szwecji, który nie będąc pewnym uczuć wybranki postanawia wybrać się, w ostatni dzień roku, na spacer przez zaśnieżony las w poszukiwaniu prawdy.

Według tradycji, na swojej drodze napotkamy różnego rodzaju postacie nadnaturalne, dzięki którym, po zdobyciu ich przychylności, przybliżymy się do poznania odpowiedzi na nurtujące pytanie.

Już na pierwszy rzut oka widać, iż jest to odświeżony port mobilny. Poruszać możemy się tylko na boki oraz, tylko w wyznaczonych miejscach, do przodu lub tyłu. Nie uświadczymy tu żadnych elementów zręcznościowych. Naszym jedynym celem jest eksploracja, która klimatem zachęca do zwiedzenia całego lasu, nie tylko jednokrotnie.

Grafika jest troszkę minimalistyczna, jednak piękna i urzekająca. Zaśnieżony las wspaniale kontrastuje, z wszechoboecną ciemnością a muzyka pojawiająca się w odpowiednich momentach idealnie buduje napięcie i podnieca płomień ciekawości, który z każdą minutą żarzy się coraz mocniej.

Zagadki są idealne - łatwe w rozwiązaniu, jednak ciężkie do odgadnięcia. Gra daje nam możliwość korzystania z mapy oraz podpowiedzi, jednak polecam grać bez nich, gdyż troszkę psuje to klimat. Mapę natomiast polecam rysować samemu. Większa immersja gwarantowana.

Na upartego jedynym minusem gry jest czas. Podczas speedrunu udało mi się ukończyć wędrówkę w mniej niż piętnaście minut. Jednak przy pierwszym podejściu do tytułu, nad głowieniem się spędziłem aż dwie godziny. Co w przypadku przygodówek dobrym czasem nie jest.

Nie ma tu błędów zarówno technicznych, jak i fabularnych, więc ciężko Year Walk opisywać, nie spojlując jednocześnie. Jest to jedna z tych gier, które krótki czas wynagradzają wspaniałą historią i ciężkim klimatem. Ponadto, moim zdaniem, jest idealnie długa. Nie za krótka i nie na tyle długa, by zaczęła nudzić.Dla osób, które uważają, że to jednak mało, zostały przygotowane achievementy, które skutecznie zachęcają do ponownej eksploracji.

Zdecydowanie polecam i uważam, że pomimo jednej bezsensownej zagadki, jest to tytuł wybitny, jakich w zaśnieżonym lesie, w nocy szukać. W trzech słowach: nieszablonowo, klimatycznie, zmysłowo. Ponownie: zachęcam do zagrania. Mnie tymczasem czeka kolejny spacer.

15055147.review:
Yearwalk is a fantastic historically-based, first-person adventure game. The minimalistic graphics are beautiful, and can be beheld on a potato. Coupled with the kick-butt soundtrack, the immersion in this game is top notch. The story is rather short (If you know what you are doing, it only takes about a quarter of an hour), but it holds some replay value (as there is another ending option). Yearwalk is based on the Swedish tradition of Yearwalking, a long forgotten ritual of old. Not only did this game stay with me on an intellectual level for quite some time, but it also piqued my interest in Swedish folklore.
This game can definitely be seen as an interactive movie, and as such it may not be for everyone. Overall, I would say it's only lacking in length. 
8.5/10

15050249.review:
Year Walk is a game that requires and rewards obsession. This isn’t saying  so very much. It’s about two hours. You only have to work up a little obsession, a little checking and rechecking, a few scribbled notes, light diagramming. Year Walk is not difficult. It only asks mindset enough to engage with its premise. Yes, engage in minor self-deprivation, fast, avoid festivals, and set out into the night to find the future, if you can only face everything within these woods.

I am not always the greatest player of games like this, due to impatience and a tendency to try to solve even straightforwardish puzzles by overthinking, but the strength of Year Walk is its dark folklore tone, its eerily blocky art, the loneliness of the forest until you’re suddenly not alone. This is 90% atmosphere, but it’s great atmosphere. And you do have to read the encyclopedia, which contains my favorite style of game lore, all mildly oblique supernatural rumor contextualized with cultural rooting.

The story framing the Year Walk itself relies on some tropes that I won’t spoil, but don’t do much for me. However, it’s also beside the point. The presentation is creepily fantastic, the mood is perfect, and what else are you playing for?

14937887.review:
Holy Gaben, this is some really hard hitting stuff!

Year Walk is a extremely strange game, that may be obtuse at times, but still generates so much genuine suspense and fear that you will be TERRIFIED to play this game for more than few-minute sessions. Interestingly enough, this isn't a pure horror game. While there are some jumpscares, they are not very common. They won't throw you out the experience. A really, REALLY CREEPY experience.

The subject matter is extremely interesting. Swedish folklore is used here to the full extend and it's really fascinating. You are often encouraged and rewarded by checking game's implemented mini-encyclopedia, which is full of interesting reads. As for gameplay itself - it's mostly a point-and-click adventure game, but very unorthodox one. Control scheme and feel is very unique and hard to explain, but it definitely works. Puzzles are also pretty imaginative. They sometimes are a liiiitle too hard for my taste, but I didn't bother to much...

With the High Octane Creepy Atmosphere, wonderful yet terrifying soundtrack and artstyle and some pretty mind-blowing tricks under the sleeve, I can easily recommend this game for all of you artsy indie-hipsters that dare to make a Year Walk.

There will be consequences...

14832327.review:
Year Walk是一款氛围绝赞的point & click游戏。
游戏的标题——Year Walk，在瑞典语中写作Årsgång，是实际存在于瑞典的一种宗教仪式。Year Walker们为了一窥来年的运势，会在每年的最后一天独身一人呆在屋内，绝水绝粮。午夜时分，他们起身前往教堂，绕行三周，并向钥匙孔中吹气。在此之后，他们会受到各路精怪的试炼，如果成功通过，便能瞥见未来的预兆。
而本作正是用游戏的方式再现了这一古老的宗教仪式。

[h1]音画：[/h1]
音乐试听地址：[url]http://danielolsen.bandcamp.com/album/year-walk[/url]
游戏中的音乐几乎只在触发事件后播放，更常见的背景音效是踩在雪地上的声音+风声。不过所有音乐都与当时的情景非常契合：磨坊姑娘Stina的温柔、目睹异象时的诡异、接受试炼时的紧张等都能够很好的通过音乐传达给玩家。
游戏采用剪纸拼接风格的单色画面，搭配上老电影式的画面噪点特效，营造出了一种肃杀而怪异的氛围，与其民间传说的基调相得益彰。

[h1]剧情：[/h1]
主角为了了解自己与磨坊姑娘Stina的恋情究竟会如何发展，毅然踏上了Year Walk之旅，但历经万难的结果是……？
剧情虽不复杂，但表现形式非常特殊。玩家需要通过阅读游戏自带的百科及日志才能够了解事情的真相，从不明觉厉转为西斯空寂。不过由于Steam版没汉化，百科跟日志的文字量不小，对语言的要求相对较高。

[h1]其他：[/h1]
虽是移植，相较iOS版，作者对Steam版做了不少改变。比如内置了原本需要另外下载的百科及日志，为Steam版制作了新的谜题等，与其他的手游移植相比可谓良心，推荐玩过iOS版的各位也可以再尝试一下。
最后，Year Walk这一仪式及游戏中出现的精怪皆直接取材于瑞典传说，玩家在游玩同时能够了解到瑞典的民间文化，可谓一举两得。衷心希望国产游戏也能推出更多如实反映我国民间文化的作品，让“民族的就是世界的”这一口号不再是一句空谈。
