14760808.review:
An odd game, or rather mini-story, that I would recommend, but DO NOT pay the full price. Here is a time where I wish Steam would have an "OK" recommendation instead of Yes or No.

Length-wise, Year Walk is rather disappointing. I do not understand that some people can take hours with it. Just by wandering around helplessly, and using only 2 hints, I ended up finishing in around 30 minutes, and that's with seeing everything that you can see except for the alternate ending. Immediately afterwards, I got into the journal, and I racked up my game time from sitting there at different pages--because I saw how many entries there were, I started cooking myself dinner while going back and forth to the journal. In reality, you can probably read and fully engross yourself in the journal within about 20 minutes, and I picked up on what I was supposed to do and got the alternate ending immediately. After that, there is no replayability to the game at all.

Now, when I first started the game, I sat down and read the Encyclopedia without going anywhere, and I was greatly interested in the folklore as it was described there. Afterwards, I ran through the whole game in one sitting. To be honest, nothing special seemed to be happening the whole game other than "Hey, look, you're encountering everything you just read about!" But besides solving a puzzle or two for each being, nothing really happened. Then you get to the end of the game and you're like "What just happened?"

By going through the alternate ending, you understand what happened. And as some people seem to argue that the ending means that the story can change, I argue on the other end. The alternate ending implies that everything is completely fixed and has no leeway.

What I liked about the game, essentially, boils down to the Encyclopedia, the Journal, and the alternate ending. I was rather okay with the first ending being this weird ambiguous mess, but to be honest, I didn't really like much of your first playthrough. You're given all of the beings you just read about... but it just felt somewhat cheesy and slopped together. The atmosphere overall was alright though, but I never once got a scared feeling from the game (even with my headphones and the dark).

I didn't pay full price for the game, and I am rather glad. Altogether, it is an interesting idea, but it is not much of your time. I understand everything in the game, but it's not going to engulf me and fill my mind forever like some people are posting on the forums. Rather, it's just a one-shot story that, while I did enjoy the story, could have used more development in the actual experience of the Year Walk itself.

14736481.review:
Заметила эту игру еще в начале 2013. Описание, видео и скриншоты впечатлили, но тут обнаружился подвох – она оказалась доступной только на iOS. Я тогда несерьезно относилась к играм для мобильных платформ, не считая, что там может быть что-то действительно достойное. Но все-таки игра очень сильно зацепила и я понадеялась, что она выйдет и на ПК. И через год это произошло. Я немедленно приступила к игре и прошла ее за два дня. В итоге Year Walk стала для меня одной из лучших игр 2014 года и изменила мое мнение об играх для мобильных платформ.
Атмосфера в игре просто потрясающая. Сразу же как будто действительно оказываешься в зимнем лесу. Я играла ночью в наушниках и было даже жутковато. Такому сильному погружению способствует все: сюжет, необычно выполненные живые локации, шикарная музыка и звуки.
Мне очень нравится тема фольклора и балансирование где-то на грани реальности и вымысла. Интересно было узнать больше о шведских верованиях. Прямо чувствовалось прошлое, когда это все было для людей частью их жизни. Развязка оказалась полной неожиданностью, что я очень уважаю.
[spoiler]Хотя правильней сказать, что есть два финала и оба неожиданные.[/spoiler]
Головоломки не сложные, но отлично вписаны в игру. Хотя если к ним причислить перемещение по запутанным тропинкам, то одна сложная все-таки есть. Я обожаю лабиринты, так что карту не открывала пока не начала без труда ориентироваться в лесу. Еще понравилось, что записи нужно вести самостоятельно и, что никто не водит за ручку: вот вам игра, разбирайтесь.

14734051.review:
« Year Walk » est un point & click basé sur une légende folklorique suédoise selon laquelle les hommes par le passé tentaient de connaître leur futur en participant à un rituel impliquant une marche d'un an à la rencontre des esprits de la nature.

Si l'expérience de jeu - très courte - reste envoutante par son ambiance nordique et son sympathique rendu géométrique type scrapbook, elle est à l'inverse complètement plombée à mon sens par des "énigmes" trop simples et une narration maladroite et brouillonne. Un jeu somme toute peu plaisant à jouer qui oblige le joueur à se plonger dans une documentation annexe (non-localisée... merci les mecs!) pour comprendre son scénario, malgré tout assez intéressant. On saluera cependant la double fin intelligemment intégrée.

Même si je ne peux pas en toute honnêteté descendre « Year Walk », je trouve qu'il lui manque tout de même un certain nombre de choses pour que je puisse pour autant le recommander. Si je devais le comparer à un plat, « Year Walk » aurait du gout mais ne remplirait pas le ventre! Ou inversement, à vous de voir...

14638380.review:
Year Walk - проект, разработанный студией "Simogo" и был выпущен 21 февраля на мобильные устройства и 6 марта 2014 появился на PC. Игра в жанре приключенческого хоррора с элементами головоломки.

Вы выступаете в роли скандинавского парня, который хочет познать будущее. «Новогодние походы» - это скандинавская традиция, когда перед новым годом, молодой мужчина не пьет, не ест и не общается с другими людьми, а в полночь идет через лес к церкви чтобы познать свое будущее. 

В игре вам придется столкнуться именно с этим. По пути вы встретите различные фольклорные существа и головоломки, которые вам предстоит разгадать. И не думайте, что это будет настолько легко. Сразу советую вам подготовить листок бумаги, на котором вы будете делать заметки всего того, что вы увидите или услышите! Но даже если вы и сделаете так, игра все равно будет весьма нелегкой, т.к. вам практически не объясняют, что именно нужно делать и подсказок будет минимальное количество. Так же можно запросто потеряться в слоях смешанного 2D и 3D мира, и долго продолжать поиски верного пути.

Но оно того стоит! Игра передает очень впечатляющую атмосферу, начиная с очень красивой прорисовки, переходя к озвучки шагов по снегу и окружающей среды и заканчивая затягивающем музыкальным сопровождением. Разработчики даже не стали использовать какой-нибудь красивый интерфейс, чтобы не портить восприятия. Тут можно игре и простить тот факт, что в плане страха она уступает многим играм. Управление очень простое и вам всего лишь понадобятся W, A, S, D и мышка.

В общем я рекомендую игру всем, кто любит игры такого жанра, поиграть в эту вещь и самому оценить ее. На прохождение понадобится 1-3 часа, если вы не будете зацикливаться на каждой головоломке . Рекомендую также играть в наушниках и в темноте, чтобы полностью втянутся в атмосферу и получить максимальное наслаждение.

P.S.: Если вы прошли игру, то советую пройти еще раз, чтобы увидеть другую концовку.

Плюсы:
- Отличная атмосфера
- Довольно сложные головоломки
- Простое управление
- Несколько концовок

Минусы:
- Некоторые головоломки могут создать большие проблемы
- Слишком короткое прохождение (~2 часа)

Реиграбельность:
- Возможно

Итог: Игра очень хорошая и заставляет подумать, но если вы не очень терпеливы, желание играть может пропасть. [8/10]

14630928.review:
Лучшая атмосферная игра, в которую погружался за последнее время.
Самое сложное было - подобрать момент морального состояния и настроения, чтобы такое было в удовольствие. Человеку, который любит разные жанры, как кровь и расчлененку с бурлящей кровью, так и мистику и холодной депрессией, подобрать такой момент может занять время~

И всё же Year Walk - шедевральная игра. Достаточно короткая.
У неё завораживающий стиль, к которому превыкаешь уже после первых 10 минут. Стиль бы подобран для передачи эмоций и атмосферы, игру трудно представить в каком-то другом виде, и чтобы все эмоции сохранялись.
Приятная фоновая музыка и музыкальные вставки. Лёгкие страшилки, но такие, чтобы атмосфера провоцировала мурашки, или же холод одиночества.
Игра для уединения глубоко в себя.

Каждый пазл этого квеста тривиален и прост, потому как нет каких-то извращений. Главное - внимательность. Вот - все решения на блюдичке, ты только будь внимательнее к деталям, обращай взор на каждое изменение. И не забудь прочесть истории из внутриигровой энциклопедии.
К слову, после этой игры пожалуй примусь за Шведскую и Скандинавские мифологии и фольклор. Как гласит сама экциклопедия, всё что в игре основана именно на них. А хочется ещё больше.
Да, такие игры штучные. И их хочется больше.

14628374.review:
It's been a long time since I've played a point-and-click game as enchanting as Year Walk.

It starts you out with very little direction, and you only start piecing together your objectives as you wander around the eerie winter setting. There's an encyclopedia in-game that you can reference as well (And adds a bit of structure to your journey), and the lore it contains is a bizarre guide to the mythology of "year walking."

Now, the trap that most point-and-click games fall into is breaking their own logic for the sake of difficult puzzles. This results in bizarre, non-intuitive puzzles that takes, at best, some serious imagination to find solutions to, and at worst, brute-forcing. Year Walk does not do this. It stays very grounded in the world it builds, and everything can be deduced through environmental exploration and logical deduction, giving the player satisfaction with each puzzle solved.

Now, it [i]is[/i] a short game, but it's far more memorable than most games I've played. Check it out.

14511689.review:
Of all the games that I’ve played in Review Series I, none of them kept me as enthralled as Year Walk did. Let’s dig in.

I – Story [10/10]

Year Walk is an indie adventure game from Simogo. The game begins with a young man (the player) visiting his lover. She hints that she has received a proposal from another suitor which she intends to accept. The player then informs her that he plans to go year walking (a vision journey rumored to give the walker a glimpse into the future), which causes the girl to warn the player against the dangers of the activity; stating that her cousin died doing that very thing. The player returns home and wakes at midnight to begin their year walk. Throughout the night, the player encounters several supernatural entities and puzzles that must be solved in order to complete the year walk.

I’m stopping the story retelling there because I absolutely refuse to spoil it. It is. hands down, incredible.

II – UI [10/10]

The user interface was extremely minimal, which did wonders for the immersion in Year Walk. You have a small, circular reticle which is present on the screen for the majority of the game, but, beyond that, there’s not much. Your HUD consists of directional arrows that fade in and out on the bottom and top of the screen when you can move in that direction. An unobtrusive, collapsible bar in the top right corner of the screen holds everything else you’ll need to get through the game.

III – Gameplay [10/10]

Year Walk was very much like an interactive storybook. It played like an intricate pop-up book and was incredibly unique. Actual gameplay in Year Walk is as simple as can be. Manipulating the W, A, S, and D keys (or the arrow keys, alternatively) allows you to navigate around the game world. Any interactions are performed via the reticle. Any control scheme that was more complex probably would have ruined the whole feel of the game. It all worked perfectly.

In addition to this, you’re predominantly left to figure things out all on your own. There are hints that can be accessed for each chapter of the story, but if you use your head, you can puzzle everything out for yourself in a few minutes.

Also, be prepared to do a fair bit of reading. You’ll see what I mean when you play the game.

IV – Content [10/10]

Year Walk I initially thought would be hard to pin a score down for it’s level of content. However, after some careful consideration, I’ve decided that it had the perfect amount of content for it’s story. In fact, it had a lot more than I originally anticipated.

V – Visual [10/10]

By now, you all should know that I’m a complete sucker for morbidity and hand-drawn art. Year Walk was absolutely no exception to this rule. The artwork was gorgeous. Everything was very dark and somber. If you’re exploring the world and you don’t find yourself pausing to admire the landscape and the landmarks every once in a while, you’re playing it the completely wrong way.

VI – Audio [10/10]

The soundtrack of Year Walk routinely sent shivers down my spine. The song at the end credits is chilling, especially in the context of the ending of the game. Or should I say, one of the endings. The sounds of Year Walk were sheer brilliance too. You’re guaranteed to feel creeped out at least once during a playthrough, but probably more than once. Aurally, Year Walk is a beautiful smorgasbord of music and sound.

VII – Overall [10/10]

Overall, Year Walk is a fantastic game.

Year Walk isn't really all that much a game but more of an interactive story. A story that you cannot alter no matter what you do. You only move around on the map, do a few puzzles, and the story progresses. The sad thing about the puzzles are that it is impossible to solve them without looking at the hints and still it's extremely difficult. Chances are you'll be utilizing an online walkthrough to guide you through a story that you have no control over. It also has ZERO replayability as it's only appeal is the unfolding of the story. Like a book, once you've read it, you're done with it.

The only pluses that Year Walk has are that it's relatively cheap and that the story is interesting. If you like a good mystery story with psychologically creepy imagery then this is for you. If you're looking for a puzzle game solely because you want to solve puzzles then you'll be disappointed.

I'm recommending this title but barely. Had it been a few dollars more I would have said no.

14331735.review:
Year Walk is definitely an interesting game, maybe less so 'game' but huge emphasis on interesting. I would call this a visual story (not to be confused with a visual novel) and while most games are obviously 'visual stories', I'll try to give a reason as to why I call it that. I'll start with the gameplay as that will help me get my point across. 

Your character (never given a name) is put into this beautiful snowy landscape. The only movements you can make are to walk left and right, or forwards and backwards on paths. You have a cursor so you can click on objects here and there, but there aren't a ton of things to interact with. Hence, why I say this is more of a visual story. While you do have control, I feel more like you're just watching through their eyes.

Onto the gameplay/setting. The term "Year Walk" (Årsgång) refers to a Swedish ritual that was believed to be done by people from the medieval times to the 19th century. The Year Walk was done on either Christmas Eve, or New Years. The idea is that you lock yourself in your house, void of light, no eating, drinking, or interacting with others. After which of 24 hours, the year walker is tasked with heading to their church in order to have a vision of the coming years future. There, they will have to pass the tests of supernatural creatures in order to be granted that vision.

The premise alone is very intriguing, and I knew nothing of it while diving into this game. Let me say this, I played through Year Walk in one sitting. Now, it only took me about 2.5 hours, but that time alone was very gripping and I couldn't wait to progress further along. The atmoshpere of the game is mind blowing. Play this with headphones on and in a dark room for full immersion. The game is also genuinely terrifying through it's use of the lore. Added that the soundtrack beautiful and the art is amazingly well put together, you've crafted a very serene yet eerie world that can totally draw you in and make you lose sight of things.

While I would love to tell you much more about this game, I really need to leave it up to you to discover what it holds. It's not terribly hard, puzzle wise, but there are some here and there. Also, in game, if you'd like to read up more, they provide an encyclopedia that provides some descriptions of what you'll encounter. I've also heard you need to play it more than once to really get the full picture. So, I hope you will play this as I highly recommend it. It's something that will stay with you long after it's over.

P.S. Don't worry about the box. Yet.

14249310.review:
To keep the story short - "Year Walk" is an atmospheric mystery horror adventure with an unique presentation and splendidly unsettling atmosphere. It does everything a truly unsettling psychological horror should. The strongest point is the telling of the narrative, which is brilliant, and takes (at least) 2 play-throughs to unfold.

The game has no dialogue, and offers no backstory. During your 1st play-through you'll get bits and pieces of the puzzle, but it's up to you to connect the dots, and guess and assume much, thus creating the skeleton of a story. Then during your 2nd play-through, if you choose to do a side-quest (of sorts) the true nature of things is revealed, and the story suddenly gets a crazy spin and expands majestically in scope as everything falls into place.

"Year Walk" is not so much of a game, as it is an amazing example of story-telling. Recommended, and then some!

The price is right for Year Walk, which if by nothing else is justified in its unnerving lore, quality sound effects, and unconventional gameplay experience. I'm not usually one to recommend a casual game that requires pen & paper to complete, and some of the puzzles, while inventive, distracted from my enjoyment. Some of the game's achievements also border on gratuitous, again possibly taking away from your experience depending on why you're playing a game like this.

On the positive side, Year Walk was surprisingly memorable for such a quick game (there's an achievement to complete it in under 20 minutes which is barely difficult) and has a minimalist world that the player will want to explore. There are so many things that tie in to subsequent playthroughs, assuming you are dedicated enough to find Year Walk's many secrets.

7/10.

14176857.review:
Year Walk is a game that first came out on iOS, but it caught my attention very early on. Above all else, you have to know what you're getting into, to properly enjoy it. This is [b]not[/b] a game, in the traditional sense, but it certainly requires player input! Even more than many games, somehow.
It's a very unique experience, certainly worth trying! Plus, you might learn a bit more about swedish folklore.

[b][u]Context[/u][/b]
I find it very similar to Fez, in a way. Year Walk is a riddle in and of itself. Its challenges rely on concepts more than anything the game directly teaches you, but all the clues are present for you to succeed. Also, it was clearly designed for multiple playthroughs (at least 2.5 - 3), and it was brilliantly made, with that in mind.

I'm a sucker for mythology and folklore in general, so I had been interested in this game for a while. If you're trying it just "because", you might be lost for a while, and find it frustrating.

Going back to the Fez point: Fez was much harder and more cryptic, because its clues were very spread apart. There were lots of different areas, and it also relied on many skills completely unrelated to the game.
Year Walk is not like that. While the game is mostly a riddle, you can get everything you need inside the game. I'd advise either taking notes, or screenshots and being very aware of your in-game surroundings, otherwise you'll probably be walking in circles.


[b][u]Presentation[/u][/b]
The game is certainly fairly minimalist in its design, but I think it knew exactly what it needed to be. The [b]visuals[/b] are digital, but made to simulate paper cut-outs, which goes hand in hand with old folklore. Its use of color is also noteworthy, and while very subtle, it very much contributes to the overall atmosphere.

[b][i]Interface issues[/i][/b]
The interface looks, perhaps, a bit too modern, but it's not too bad. The port is mostly okay, although there's a bit of disconnection to the pc, clearly. While there aren't big, intrusive buttons, they haven't really mapped any hot-keys that would have been [i]really[/i] useful (using M for map, or E for encyclopedia, for example), and you have to click everything. Then, in a puzzle, they have you use "u" and "n"! It was the hardest puzzle for me, haha! It clearly said "u" and "n" on the screen, but it felt so out of place that it took me a while to try it. Oh well.

The [b]sound-effects[/b] are a bit space-y, which feels a bit weird, but it sort of fits. They're well done, but I would have liked something more traditional.

The [b]music[/b], thought, is definitely one of the aspects where it shines! (Of course, this is biased.)
It's mostly quiet and atmospheric, but it gives you an eerie feeling at times, through two main aspects: slight dissonance, and using what seems to be aged instruments, that don't sound [i]quite right[/i]. These two aspects have been in my mind for a while, on how to make creepy music... So there you go. Of course, I found it great! But honestly, I think it works, and gives it a very natural feeling. Good job!
There's a problem, though:

[b][i]No sound on the menus[/i][/b]
Whenever you open the map, or the encyclopedia, the music stops. That... is a problem, and a big one, in my opinion.
In a game that relies so much on atmosphere, a continuous flow of sound is critical. If you need to open the map (which should often happen, especially during your first playthrough -- a the one that relies the most on atmosphere!), the music stops, and it completely breaks immersion. I seem to mention this in a lot of games, recently, but it's really important! 
Having the music cut-out when you have to do something as simple as opening a map... that's bad. Furthermore, it makes those menus seem completely out of the experience that the game was going for. 
I'd like to see this changed, at least in future games, but hey... it's not [i]game-breaking[/i], I guess.


[b][u]Game Mechanics[/u][/b]
To start off, this is an adventure game. Instead of being a point n' click, however, you can walk in 2D, in several lanes set in 3D. You can go back and forth to change lane, at specific points. It can be a bit confusing, at first, but there's a map, and while your first playthrough feels a bit alien, it all makes sense after that. And it's still very compelling.

[b][i]Puzzles vs. Riddles[/i][/b]
I'll make this clear right away. A puzzle, in my eyes, is based on mechanics that a game teaches you. Most games work like this.
A riddle, on the other hand, relies on something beyond the game. These skills are mostly learned outside of the game, and makes what could be "puzzles", mostly unrelated to one another. 

This is why I say Year Walk is more of a riddle. 
There are clues inside the game, of course, but it never teaches you anything. It never starts easy and gets progressively harder. Not at all. Every riddle is like a self-contained puzzle, reliant on combining the clues, and skills you have acquired outside the game. 

Some of the puzzles are based on listening cues, some are based on [i]soft[/i]cryptography, etc. But I think it's balanced. I managed to go through my first playthrough without getting stuck  at any point, and without using Hints. But again, you need to be in the right mindset to enjoy it! 

These riddles are based on the mythological creatures you'll find in the game. You won't, of course, know what these creatures are, or why they're there. And that's normal. To complement the game, there's an [b]Encyclopedia[/b]. This is merely a collection of texts, one about each creature or event you're playing. It's not a direct guide for the game, as it doesn't really help with the [i]solving a puzzle[/i], but it gives context to what you're doing! And may also give you some clues on where the solution may lie.
I've found it very interesting, but it's still about reading [i]outside the game[/i]! It's the same problem that Type:Rider had, the way it never taught you through gameplay, but through wikipedia-esque articles.

Year Walk doesn't function this way! But it has some similar problems. Still, the creatures are [i]still[/i]in the game, but it would have felt much better to have some more integration of the Encyclopedia in the game. Maybe some more clues to the puzzles... I believe the Encyclopedia was a companion app for the iOS game, so that's it doesn't quite feel a part of the game, unfortunately.

[b][i]Symbolism in the game[/i][/b]
I think this is the best part of the game, by far! Every encounter has some meaning. It will not be apparent at all, the first time. However, the game always gives you slight clues on what to do next. On your second playthrough, it's quite different. I don't want to spoil it, but it's about reading an Historian's "diary" while he was investigating the tradition of Year Walk. It's [i]all[/i] reading (and there's a lot of it), and also taking notes to solve the last puzzle in the game. Again, it's completely detached from [i]playing[/i] the game, but it's as interesting as it makes you feel like a detective!

This diary tells the actual story of the, as if it happened a few centuries ago. While you're reading this, everything you encountered in the game starts making sense. 
This is the first part of the journal. 
The second is far more conspiracy-like and esoteric, but due to the very believable first part, you start questioning everything that's happened in the game, up to that point! It was one of the most compelling experiences I've recently had in a game! 

Every symbol is explained in the game! Not initially, but it is. And that's the way to do it! You won't leave it feeling like it was just pretentious gibberish. It's genuinely interesting, and the questions extend the game itself!

Already out of words... Seriously, this is one of the most interesting experiences on Steam, and is one that's based on [i]real[/i] folklore, which is always a plus!

14094653.review:
My first playthrough of Year Walk took two nights, simply because I was so overwrought after the first half that I needed a break. I was initially a little pissed, albeit unsurprised at the ending, but I couldn't get it out of my head. I play a lot of horror games but this one really got to me.
LET IT BE NOTED : Yeah, it's a horror game but don't expect tons of gore or anything. A few jumpscares, a little blood, and that's it. Mostly it's the symbolic weight of all those things that got to me personally, ESPECIALLY after reading the encyclopedia and journal in-depth. It's very heavy. When I finally got the true ending (admittedly on my third attempt with a smigen of cheating) it became even heavier, but more satisfying and beautiful. 
This game is for those who have the ability to immerse themselves in a mythical tale of adventure, observation, sacrifice, and love. Everyone says this game is "meant to be played twice," which is entirely true but I know there's even more. I fully intend to uncover all that I can.

14047503.review:
[h1]Описание:[/h1]
Игру можно наверное отнести к жанру - инди поинт анд клик квест с элементами хорора и головоломки... Нам предстоит играть за молодого человека который проживает в далекой Швеции и решает пройти обряд позволяющий узнать будущее - Прогулку сквозь годы. Он представляет из себя длительное прибывание без еды и воды с последующим выходом в лес и встречей с мистическими существами из древнего шведского фольклора. Именно этим мы и будем заниматься на протяжении всей игры. Путешествовать по карте, встречать существ и иногда бояться их, решать головоломки и узнавать сюжет. 

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
¥ Атмосфера. Нас прямо погружают в этот мир и не хочется из него выходить. Графика с музыкой выполнены на должном уровне чтобы создать представление, что мы действительно в Швеции гуляем по лесу.
¥ Описание существ, карта, подсказки... Все, что и должно быть у нормальной игры, но про, что очень часто забывают другие разработчики. Хочешь пользуйся, хочешь нет (и получай ачивки)
¥ Игра иногда действительно пугает. Причем даже не скримерами, а тем, что их нет там, где мы их ожидаем. Слово хоррор в жанре игры разработчики уж точно оправдали.
¥ Сюжет полностью раскрывающийся только после прохождения игры.

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
¥ Загадки не всегда логичны.
¥ Достижения совсем доставляют радости. Пришлось даже прибегать к помощи посторонних, чтобы понять, а что же им начертить там надо или нажать на экране. А достижение - зайдите в игру 31 декабря... Вообще убило. (хорошо, что можно получить просто переставив дату на компе)
¥ Нет русского языка (есть русификатор на ZoG но довольно посредственный + нет перевода финальных газетных статей в игре)

[h1]Советы:[/h1]
¥ В начале игры возьмите бумажку и ручку, куда на протяжении всей игры записывайте все, что вам показалось подозрительным. Точки на деревьях, рисунки и тп.
¥ После прохождения игры - зайдите в дневник (для этого титры досмотрите до конца) тогда вам откроется настоящий сюжет игры и вторая концовка.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]
Хоть и на пару часов... Но я окунулся в игру и прошел ее с огромным удовольствием дважды. Однозначно рекомендую всем любителям квестов, головоломок, хорроров и зимних лесов :)

[h1]Оценка: 8/10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.

แม้ตัวเกมจะสั้น เพราะเดิมทีเป็นแค่เกมเล็กๆบนสมาร์ทโฟน แต่คุณค่าของตัวเกมนั้นไม่เล็กเลย

ทำให้ Year Walk เป็นเกมผีที่สามารถพูดได้เต็มปากว่า "ยอดเยี่ยม" 

(9/10) C:

13988239.review:
[b]Year Walk[/b], un Puzzle Game in tinta Horror.
Il risultato di una miscela ben riuscita tra leggende e superstizioni scandinave, adattate ad un'avventura non molto longeva, e percorribile anche in soli 20 min.

[h1]Il Gameplay[/h1]
Si apre in una mattina d'inverno, fredda, tranquilla e soprattutto [b]misteriosa[/b].
Ci verranno suggeriti dal titolo i controlli per spostarci (w,a,s,d), la meccanica dell'esplorazione (atipica) che permetterà di spaziare anche in profondità, per poi abbandonarci nella notte che segue.
In cui si svolgerà un [b]evento particolare[/b] da cui il gioco prende il nome, appunto l'Year Walk.

Secondo questa leggenda, [b]l'ultima notte dell'anno[/b] si può vagare nella foresta nella speranza di incontrare creature mistiche, tra le quali [b]"L'Huldra"[/b], una sorta di Guardiana delle foresta, [b]"Brook"[/b], che viene rappresentato come un cavallo bianco, e che secondo i racconti lo si potrebbe trovare in prossimità dei fiumi, e trarrebbe in inganno i passanti per poi trascinarli nei meandri degli abissi, ancora i [b]"Myling"[/b], e molte altre figure, che saranno protagoniste di questa mainstory interessante.

Nel corso della nostra permanenza, si avrà la possibilità di consultare un enciclopedia, per approfondire se lo si vuole, il significato di alcune presenze e di alcune credenze.
La mappa non è molto ampia, ma questo non risulta rilevante, è abbastanza semplice ed intuitiva, segnata dai vari percorsi percorribili, da utilizzare in diverse situazioni per rendere più fluida l'esplorazione.

Nella risoluzione di alcuni puzzle potrebbero emergere delle fasi di Backtracking, tutt'altro che insistenti, e non faranno poi storcere il naso, soprattutto ai giocatori che finiranno per essere inghiottiti dall'ambientazione e cullati da un comparto audio tranquillo e a tratti inquietante.
Lo stile grafico è particolare, minimale, e fa da collante perfetto con le vicende mistiche che si svolgono in questa piccola cittadina, partorita dalla creatività degli sviluppatori.

Il gioco risulta in definitiva un prodotto che merita, e che si è fatto apprezzare molto, consiglio pienamente l'acquisto a tutti!

13978112.review:
Year Walk is a short, creepy adventure that is 2 parts adventure game and 1 part interactive fiction. 

Inspired by the Swedish folk tradition of Arsgang, Year Walk sets you in the shoes of someone who dares to undertake this strange journey.

The art and simple controls, as well as the sensation that you are watching an old film complete with tears and dust on the print, put you into a realm where anything could happen. It is not without some quality jump scares and unsettling imagery. There is a bit of Lovecraftian horror dwelling within Year Walk.

The puzzles fit into the world well, although while manipulating them you can tell the game was conceived for tablets. It should not diminish any enjoyment, however. They are clever enough to make the player feel smart upon completing them. 

And the less you know going into it, all the better. Year Walk is worth it for fans of interactive fiction games and creepy short stories.

13977180.review:
i'm a very big fan of folklore, especially scandinavian. other games i've played that try to touch on folklore either don't give enough background and end up confusing, or give way too much information and feel like a history lesson. this game balances the historical information with the gameplay very well. you get to interact with every character you learn about in the game and some levels aren't possible to beat without knowing the history.

the gameplay is a bit confusing since there aren't many games that are 2D and first person, but you do get used to it pretty easily. i wouldn't call this a puzzle game, but you do have to use critical thinking if you want to move on in the story, unless you use a walkthrough like i did. for me puzzle games have to do with finding patterns in the physical properties of objects. in this game, you are given hints as to how to get past the chapter in the story in the form of riddles, and you have to decipher the riddles. i guess this would really be a riddle game instead of a puzzle game.

the story is not linear and you only get clued into the plot at the very beginning and the end. the game starts with the main character visiting his girlfriend, where we learn a bit about the characters and get some background on what "year walks" are. you don't eat or drink for a day, then you walk into the woods at midnight in search of clues for what will happen in the future. this is loosely based on a swedish tradition. the next day you begin the year walk, and the plot is not mentioned for a while. the majority of the game is solving a series of challenges presented by and involving different scandinavian folk figures. the game provides an encyclopedia where you can read about every creature in the game. this gives clues to their nature and behavior, and sometimes helps to solve puzzles. when you finally get to the end, you get a glimpse into the main character's future, which i won't say since it will ruin the game.

however, this is not the end. the game ends in a tragedy, but it gives you a chance to right your wrongs by switching perspective to a modern-day historian who is researching the year walks. he gives you a riddle that lets you view a journal he has been keeping about the events of the game. some people say the journal is a long read, but it only took a few minutes of my time. this part of the game is almost a different genre; it seems more like a detective short story than a surreal video game. the historian is haunted by the creatures you interact with from the game as they show him how to help the main character. his research into the year walk tradition explains a lot about the plot. i will say that this whole aspect of the game seems a bit out of place: like the developers just threw it in because they felt like people would be confused by the twist ending or wonder how the game ties into the real world. ultimately it created a bit more confusion than was already present, but since you get a chance to save a very likeable character it makes a good addition to the game. the alternate ending created by the journal does involve the very overused (especially in games) cliche of heroic sacrifice.

none of this would really matter if the game didn't have nice aesthetics though. it doesn't try to make up for anything with them, but the simplistic gameplay and virtual lack of dialogue would make for a very boring game if it weren't for the way this game looks. the graphics go along very well with the gameplay and other stylistic choices for the game, like the use of runes, the setting, the light horror aspect, and the depiction of the folk figures. allegedly the developer of the game researched horror movies to get the timing right on the spooky scenes, and it really shows. right when the music gets peaceful and the graphics become fluid and lure you into a false sense of security, some spooky pagan [spoiler] shit [/spoiler] will come flying at you out of the blue. people are very averse to the jump scare, and most fans of horror and critics will say that it's a cheap or uncreative tactic, but just like everything it has its place, and there are some times where it's appropriate to use it. unlike most of the horror genre, where the jump scare is used so much it becomes a joke amongst the audience, this game knows when to trigger a fight or flight response.

besides minor flaws i talked about, this is one of my favorite games right now. i know most folklore fans don't give a [spoiler] shit [/spoiler] about games, and most gamers don't give a [spoiler] shit [/spoiler] about folklore, but this game has something to offer to both groups.

13974146.review: i am ashamed to say that this game is 2spooky for me. scurry atmosphere/10, worth the $2 or so I got it for on sale. Not sure if I'd pay full price though.

13966698.review:
Year Walk is a haunting, creepy, beautiful experience and I loved every minute of it.  The art is superb.  The music and sound design is flawless.  The puzzles are a joy to piece together.  The ambience gets progressively more chilling as the game goes on.  There are secrets that you must discover after your first playthrough, and I say MUST because you would be doing yourself a great disservice by failing to follow through and finding the  "real" ending that can only be found using clues given to you after you "beat" the game the first time.  There is actually a reason for more than one playthrough explained in the meta-narrative you'll discover if you do.

Do yourself a favor and play this game and find all of the secrets embedded within.  The secrets aren't extras, but vital for you to get the full impact of this very unique story.  Beat the game, open the journal, and then use the clues there to finish the game.  Don't cheat and look stuff up, you will cheat yourself out of one of the most unique narrative structure and reveals of any game I've ever played.

Wonderful job by the developer. Absolutely fantastic.

(p.s. -- I would also reccomend reading the in-game encylopedia as you start the game the first time.  It gives a lot of background for the Swedish folklore that this game uses that will help establish the atmosphere.)

13932741.review:
Year Walk to gra przygodowa, której fabuła jest głęboko osadzona w szwedzkim folklorze. Przeciętny gracz jest zatem do samego końca mocno skofundowany zachodząc w głowę o co, do licha, tu w ogóle chodzi. Grze nie można odmówić unikalnego klimatu podkreślonego przez specyficzną, stylizowaną na [i]stare kino[/i] grafikę. Interfejs użytkownika jest prosty do ogarnięcia aczkolwiek sposób poruszania się po świecie gry jest trochę irytujący - niby widzimy świat oczami tytułowego [i]year walkera[/i] ale zarazem jest to widok z boku charakterystyczny dla gier platformowych. Warto zapoznać się z wbudowaną w grę encyklopedią bo inaczej gra do samego końca nie będzie miała za grosz sensu.

  Największym mankamentem gry jest to, że jest ona dramatycznie krótka. Przeciętny gracz ukończy grę w czasie poniżej godziny. Teoretycznie można zagrać jeszcze raz aby poodkrywać resztę smaczków tudzież powbijać osiągnięcia. Generalnie lepiej te kilka euro wydać na coś co dostarczy więcej rozrywki. Chyba, że ktoś lubi kolekcjonować gry aspirujące do miana dzieła sztuki. A i w tej kategorii Year Walk do pięt nie dorasta przygodówkom ze stajni Amanita Design.

13893348.review:
进行了四次 Year Walk 达成全成就。
----------WARNING-----------
以下含有部分剧透




Year Walk 是宇宙时空的Bug ，人可以利用它窥视未来
但是这一行为是违背宇宙规律的，进行Year Walk的人会遭受惩罚
第一次Year Walk 讲的就是这个瑞典的民间故事，一个追求爱情的年轻人想通过Year Walk得知自己与磨坊主女儿爱情的结果
但是结局却是一个悲伤的故事。
但看一周目，除了画面和音乐有些风格外并没有太出彩的地方，平淡的一个故事。
甚至是悲伤的一个故事 I don't love you anymore
但是故事远远没有结束
依靠结尾的提示解锁了一本日志
变换成了另一种克苏鲁风格的解密，一位学者通过对Year Walk 和主角故事的研究层层抽丝剥茧把整个故事补完
读完日之后，我才感受到了这个游戏故事的魅力
第一次Year Walk 只是在阐述一个故事
日志就是对故事背景的解释，其作者也在故事里扮演了自己的角色
最后说些疑惑 Watchers 究竟是扮演这什么样的角色呢 ?
如果主角没有Year Walk 女主是否还是爱他的？
一周目的提示是日志作者提供的吗 他也进行了Year Walk ?
==================================================================
值得一玩的好游戏。
游戏风格不错不过流程略短，想要全成就就要背板和查攻略 
一定一定要进行二周目并看完日志，相当不错的克苏鲁式的故事
和人类对未知的探索终将遭受毁灭很相似
人对宇宙规则的破坏也将自食其果。

以下是我對遊戲評分

[h1]劇情: 8/10 [/h1]
基本上第一次出結局畫面時會感到莫名其妙, 不過再玩下去和看完故事之復, 就會覺得故事編排不錯, 故事佈局雖然是電影常有的情節, 但以遊戲方式表達算是少有佳作, 為了不透露任何劇情, 以免影響玩家體驗, 我在這裡不打算多說, 但建議玩之前可以了解一下什麼是Year Walk(不是去search劇情, 而是這個字詞的解譯)

[h1]遊戲性: 6/10 [/h1]
點擊遊戲好玩與否在乎佈局和解難, 老實說, 跟其他點擊遊戲一樣, 佈局一般, 很有些地方是夾硬連結在一起, in-game hins system方便了玩家, 值得一讚是, 遊戲某幾處的解難是安排不錯, 令玩家會有"啊, 竟然這樣"的感覺, 所以令遊戲性比合格多一點

[h1]畫面: 7/10 [/h1]
畫面走詭異童畫風格, 易接受也不失美感, 音樂和氣氛也配合不錯

[h1]重玩性: 1/10 [/h1]
除非執著解那些可解不解的成就, 不然一個短促故事是不用看兩遍

劇情主導的小品, 好遊戲但遊戲時數很短, 而且沒重玩性, 還是特價或入bundle時才買會比較好!

13777227.review:
스웨덴 설화를 바탕으로 한 몽환적이고 함축적인 어드벤쳐 게임.

Year Walk 라는 스웨덴 고대 미신을 바탕으로 한 게임이다. Year Walk란 12월 31일에 독방에 갖혀 식음을 전폐하고 해가 바뀌는 순간 밖으로 나가면 미래를 볼 수 있다는 미신이다. 이 미신에 대한 지식이 없었다면 게임 내용 이해의 깊이가 다를 것이다. 즉, 그냥 흔한 방탈출 게임하는거랑 크게 다르지 않다는 이야기.

게임의 분위기 자체는 상당히 뛰어나다. 몽환적이고 고요하면서도 약간은 음울한 음악, 그리고 눈이 쌓인 적막한 배경의 그래픽, 스웨덴 설화를 바탕으로 잘 살려낸 스웨덴 요괴들. 그리고 그러한 것들을 바탕으로 게임의 복선을 잘 깔아두었고, 장치들도 적절히 잘 구성되어있다. 전반적으로는 아름답지만, 때때로는 무섭기도 하고, 오싹오싹 하기도 한 어찌보면 참 훌륭한 공포 게임이기도 하다. 어드벤쳐 게임의 게임성만으로 놓고 본다면 상당히 뛰어난 게임.

게임 자체가 짧고 많은 대사가 없이 진행되는 게임이라 그냥 엔딩만 봐서는 이게 뭔가 싶을 것이다. (아니, 엔딩을 보면 대놓고 "여기에는 사실 엄청난 비밀이 숨겨져있지......" 라고 언급을 해준다.) 이른바 진엔딩이라 불리는 게임 속에 숨겨진 진실을 파헤치기 위해선 게임을 한 번 클리어해야 하고 잠겨있는 Journal을 열어 그 안에 있는 자료들을 전부 구경한 뒤, 그 자료들 속에 숨겨져 있는 암호를 알아내서 활용해야 한다. 개인적으로는 진엔딩 보자고 이리저리 머리 싸매고 하는 것 자체를 별로 안 좋아하긴 하지만......

플레이타임이 긴 게임은 아니긴 하지만, 오히려 그 짧은 플레이타임 속에 많은 것을 함축적으로 잘 넣어놓은 게임이다. 어드벤쳐 게임으로써는 상당히 훌륭한 게임이다. 배경과 캐릭터들은 예술이라고 칭해줄 정도로 뛰어나고 퍼즐의 난이도도 적당하다. 맵이나 힌트도 상당히 깔끔하게 잘 갖춰져있어 게임 플레이하는데 별로 불편한 점도 없다. 스웨덴 미신에 대한 이해가 없다면 게임의 이해가 어려워진다는 근본적인 단점 하나만 빠진다면 그야말로 최고의 평을 받아도 아깝지 않을 게임. 어드벤쳐 게임 매니아라면 꼭 해봐야 할 게임이다.

13743622.review:
WER sollte sich das Spiel anschauen?

Wer eine gute Geschichte mag.
Wer sich der melancholischen Stimmung des Spiels oder dem tristen aber guten Artsytles hingezogen fühlt.

WEM empfehle ich das Spiel NICHT:
Ungeduldigen.
Leuten, die das komplexeste Rätsel suchen, dass es noch nicht gibt.
Spieler, die den Qualitätsregler weiter nach rechts schieben müssen.
Leuten, die hier ein echtes Horrorspiel erwarten.

GRAFIK, STYLE, SOUND:
Das Spiel ist einfach, hässlich, kurz, ohne Sprachausgabe, ohne Übersetzung.
Nein, entschuldigung, hässlich ist es nicht. Der Artstyle ist sparsam, karg, aber verdammt gut. Er kommt auf den Punkt, ohne dabei unkonkret, oder zu unkonkret zu wirken. Er ist symbolhaft, wie die Metaphern im Spiel.
Das Spiel sieht gut aus, weil es so hässlich ist. Der Sound trägt exzellent zur Stimmung bei. Die Musik trägt die gleiche Schwere, wie das Spiel selbst.

DIE STEUERUNG:
Die Steuerung ist gelinde gesagt simpel, aber sie funktioniert in diesem Fall ganz gut. Man bewegt sich mit den Richtungstasten bzw. WASD zwischen den Bildern auf der Karte umher. Man merkt schon, dass das Spiel eigentlich für das wischen auf dem Tablett gemacht wurde.

GAMEPLAY:
Das Spiel will vom Spieler, dass er liest, zwingt Ihn aber nicht dazu.
Man ist nicht in Eile, kann sich Zeit nehmen, wie man will.
Die Rätsel sind recht einfach. Mit Kopfhörern zu spielen, empfiehlt sich aber auf jeden Fall.
Man bewegt sich mit den Pfeiltasten oder WASD. Die Maus dient zum interagieren an bestimmten Stellen.

HORROR oder nicht?
Ja, doch. Im klassischen Sinne. Im Sinne von ETA Hoffmann, Marry Shally, vielleicht noch Alfred Hitchkock? Eher unterhaltsam gruselig, als schockierend und explizit.
Kein Saw, kein Texas Chainsaw Massacre, eher eine Priese Sleepy Hollow, dabei lange nicht so actionreich. Oft dabei durchaus direkt, ohne aufgesetzt zu wirken. Ein bisschen gruseln vielleicht. Das Spiel löst dabei aber keine Angstzustände aus.

Fazit:

Das Spiel ist gut durchdacht, wird unterstütz durch einen guten Artstyle und exzellente akustische Untermalung.
Es ist ein bisschen kurz und wird dem PC-Spieler mit seiner für Tabletts ausgelegten Steuerung nicht ganz gerecht.
Die Limitierung der Bewegung unterstützt dabei aber gut das Storytelling.
Die mitgelieferten Wohlfühlfeatures, Ingamehints, Karte und nicht zuletzt der Enzyklopädie, die einem das Drumherum doch etwas näher bringt machen aus dem Spieler aber ein modernes Spiel, dass nicht durch unnötig komplizierte Rätsel den Spielfluss bremsen. Sicherlich könnte die Komplexität stellenweise etwas höher sein, aber so wie es ist, funktioniert es gut.

Die Storry und der Kern dieses Spiels ist fesselnd und bewegend, man muss sich jedoch darauf einlassen.
Die melancholische Stimmung ist sicherlich nichts für absolute Hedonisten, wer aber auch nur manchmal eine gewisse melancholische Stimmung verspürt, wird dieses Spiel lieben.
Das Spiel ist grausam, ja, aber nicht auf die Art, wie man es vielleicht erwartet. Nicht die Schockmomente, die hier und da platziert sind, sind die, die einen Aufwühlen, es ist die Storry selbst.

Eine Kurzgeschichte in Form eines Spiels, die einem das Tempo des Erlebens nicht vorgibt. Sie erwartet allerdings, dass man sich auf sie einlässt. Weder ist dieses Spiel ein reines Adventure, noch ein Rätselspiel, am ehesten vielleicht eine Visual Novel mit Rätselelementen. Erwartet nicht zu viele Rätsel, oder dass ihr mit 1000 Objekten interagieren müsst, aber glaubt auch nicht, dass ihr wie in einer reinen Visual Novel einfach durch den Text klickt, bis ihr eine Entscheidung treffen müsst.

Ein Hinweis, der hier schon auf englisch gefallen ist, dass es zwei Enden gibt.
Ja, die gibt es und das zweite Ende rundet die Sache ab. Vielleicht nicht so, wie man es erwartet, aber macht euch die Mühe und folgt den Anweisungen am Ende des ersten Durchgangs, um dem zweiren Weg zu folgen.

Viel Spaß beim Year Walken.

P.S: Ein guter Zeitpunkt dafür ist Silvester

Nominiert für die Steam Awards

13742147.review:
as it is new year's eve, now is a most appropriate time to write a review on [i]year walk[/i]...

[i]year walk[/i] is a strange tale, set in northern scandinavia on new year's eve.  it blends fragments off folk-lore with a little bit of horror, some surrealism and detective work.  your role in the story is not clear at first, but you soon find yourself unravelling a curious mystery.  the basic interface is point-and-click, with puzzles to be solved.  although this sounds simple enough, the reason why this game is a gem is because of the atmosphere.  the art-style, movement and sounds all combine to give this game an amazing feel.  although only drawn, and with only a few scares, the style and items you uncover will give you the most creepy feeling.  it is cleverly done and from me it is highly recommended.

but the time is getting on and i must go.  at the stroke off midnight i will venture out into the night through the dark woods where strange creatures roam.  i will make my [i]year walk[/i] to see if i will be wealthy, to see if i will be happy, to see if i will live, to see if i will be loved...

13705546.review:
"In the old days man tried to catch a glimpse of the future in the strangest of ways. Experience the ancient Swedish phenomena of year walking through a different kind of first person adventure that blurs the line between two and three dimensions, as well as reality and the supernatural."

This is hands down my favorite game of 2014. Perhaps ever. 

First of all, there is an achievement that requires you to beat the game in under 20 minutes. It can easily be done. I'd say it took about an hour my first run through. The music/sound effects are perfect --haunting and soft. There are a few "Ahhh!" scares, but only a few and that makes them even more special. The artwork is amazing - ethereal is the word that comes to mind. I found myself really interested in the folklore presented. I'm usually not big on reading, but it was really interesting and not overdone. There are some tastefully done creepy scenes. Again, not overdone. 

For someone who really struggles to stay focused on one thing for too long, this game was perfect. I was able to beat it three times and get all ten of the achievements without too much difficulty. 

I simply can not reccomend this game enough.

13691404.review:
It's a great game for Folk-lore enthusiasts. It's a beautiful game that I would say is for the casual gamer who wants puzzles mixed with a macabre and morbid story. 
There are a few "jump scares". One is a real jump scare and the others are more of viewers imagination unfolding as you think of what could be lurking next. 
I will say that this game's main point is the story and the atmosphere portrayed as you "Year Walk". So many thoughts and presumptions will go on while you play, and that is how this game sucks you in. 
Play through with an open-mind the first time and make all the presumptions that you can. The ending will then be more enjoyable or understandable as you play. 
AND DONT FORGET. NEW YEARS EVE. FOR THE ACHIVEMENT. AND FOR THE SAKE OF ATMOSPHERE.

***MADE TO BE PLAYED >TWICE< - THE FIRST ENDING IS NOT THE ENDING***
I wonder how many people miss that part. At any rate, I walked into this game with no insight into what I was going to experience.  The "first" playthough was short (about 90 minutes or so) and compelling, but then you are invited to walk again.  Do it.  The true ending is at the end of the "second" playthrough.  

Non-spoiler tip: After your first paythrough. Read the journal. Read the journal.

***NOT A HORROR GAME***
While Steam has this listed as a Horror game; it is not. There are a few moments that may take you by surprise or have some troubling imagery, but this is not a scary game.  It's a mindful journey through Scandinavian folklore.  

I enjoyed this experience, and would recommend it to others.

13067246.review:
スウェーデンの伝承を基にしたホラーゲー
絵本のような雰囲気グラフィックは非常に良く、ところどころ怖い。
きっちりホラーゲームで、道中結構ビビらされた。
マップ形式がややわかりづらいので酔うかもしれない。
難易度は個人的にはやや高めに感じた。

そして英語の壁ゲー。
話のキモが全部「読まないとわからない」タイプであるため、日本語未対応=英語の大量のアーカイブを読破しないと全く話が分からない。
このアーカイブ、もし日本語だったとしてもかなり多い。
この辺は人によってかなり好みが分かれそう。
読書作業が好きな人は楽しいだろうが、話の理解に必須の部分が全部作文で済まされていることを「ダラダラ長い」と感じる人には全くお勧めできない。
神話的伝承と怖さとせつなさが絡んだ物語は絵本調のグラフィックと相まって非常に美しいので、この長文ラッシュは個人的には一番惜しい。
ともかく完成度は高いので「物語を追うゲームが好きな人に勧める」意味でサムズアップに投票する。

ついでに2014年11月24日現在、「year walk 解説」でググればpixiv小説でゲーム内の全文を和訳している方がいることをこっそり紹介しておく。

13017409.review:
This is a beautifully constructed game.

The dark, supernatural atmosphere is fully immersive, with haunting music and sound effects, a creepy unlockable journal, traditional Scandinavian monsters, and a few jump scares that add to the surreal horror.  A warning, though:  If you are at all squeamish about blood or death, you will have a hard time playing this.  

The artwork is reminiscent of hand-cut paper collages, further enhancing the traditional folk feeling of the game.

As far as gameplay goes, it mainly involves circling through a layered snowy landscape in search of puzzles and clues.  As you advance the plot, new paths open up and new interactables appear.  The key is figuring out which puzzles you can solve right away, and which you will need to come back to later after you have more information.  Backtracking is a key component of the game, but the map is small enough that it never feels like a slog.

The built-in hint system is useful in guiding you through the main plot if you are stuck.  It contains a progressive series of hints for each chapter, with the first hint being an extremely vague nudge in the right direction, and the last hint being a blatant spoiler.  Players can control which hints are revealed and which remain hidden, so you only ever get as much information as you need.

Something I didn't realize on my first playthrough: Some puzzles require keyboard interaction, some puzzles require the mouse, some require a combination of keyboard and mouse.  If you are stuck, it might be because you didn't realize you could click and drag an object to move it, or click and hold an item to carry it.

Some of the achievements are tricky to get, but between the game itself and the achievement descriptions, you should eventually be able to figure them all out.  

While this game will likely leave you feeling depressed due to its tragic thematic elements, it is still an amazing little gem, and I would give it an overall rating of 9/10.

12919657.review: Year Walk.  This game is something.  It will not be for everyone.  The game is not huge, but I know there are a couple different endings.  The gameplay itself focuses on exploring the forest and solving puzzles from a first person perspective, but you do not walk around like a normal first person game.  You kind of slide from side to side and move forward and backward to different areas.  This is a little confusing at first but you can get used to it in ten or fifteen minutes easily.  This game is mostly focused on solving puzzles, as mentioned above.  Actually this is one of the only games to really give me the same vibe that Myst gave me all those years ago… I am not sure what it is about it.  Some of the puzzles are pretty abstract, but a lot of them have hints in the game world if you look.  But this game has a great serene atmosphere that becomes more creepy and unsettling over time.  A very melancholy but thought provoking experience, if not a short one (I beat it in two hours, but there is a speed run achievement for something like 20 minutes).

12860947.review:
Year Walk основана на шведской языческой традиции Arsgang, согласно которой накануне значимых праздников, отказываясь от еды и питья, тепла и общения в течении дня, а то и недели, можно узреть будущее. Для этого в полночь после поста шли через лес к кладбищу, где обитал церковный грим. Чтобы понять, что это за существо и в чём сложность такого паломничества, поясню. В средневековые времена под церковью хоронили животное, обычно козу, в некоторых случаях помещали в её грудь сердце осуждённого преступника. Церковным гримом и был дух этого животного. Он считался защитником церкви от воров и осквернителей, но из-за него и добропорядочные жители окрестных деревень, едва смеркалось, предпочитали обходить церковь стороной. Считалось, стоит дотронуться до сердца грима, как паломника посетят видения, которые откроют ему тайны будущего.

Шведский фольклор богат на страшилки, потому в игре вы встретите многие из них. Истории о богине леса, мёртвых детях, водном коне и воронах с чёрными дырами в крыльях тесно переплетены с основной историей игры. Перед прохождением рекомендую прочитать встроенную в игру энциклопедию - узнаете много интересного и лучше поймёте сюжетную подоплёку игры.

Геймплейно Year Walk - изометрическая бродилка от первого лица с элементами квеста и хоррора. И бродилка, стоит заметить, весьма атмосферная. Я не зря написал такое внушительно вступление в самом начале. Проникнувшись историей и традицией, вы, словно зачарованный, будете ходить по заснеженному лесу, встречать тех или иных персонажей и по ходу дела решать те или иные задачи. Записывайте и зарисовывайте всё, что видите по пути - это поможет вам в прохождении.

Визуальная сторона игры необычна, но к ней быстро привыкаешь и уже спустя минуту-другую понимаешь, что другой стиль мог бы и не подойти. Мрачные тона как нельзя лучше вписываются в общую атмосферу игры. Довершают общее впечатления музыка и звуки. Они превосходны! Мягкий скрип снега под ногами, мелодии и звуки ночного леса - всё это на высоте.

Что имеем в итоге? Небольшую мистическую историю, мрачную и в чём-то даже зловещую, которую вы наверняка пройдёте не раз и не два, ведь концовка у игры не одна. Рекомендую ли я Year Walk? Разумеется. Лично для меня - это одна из лучших инди-игр этого года. Не пропустите.


***
PS Хоть в стиме и нету русского языка, его можно добавить самому. Вот достаточно неплохой русификатор от ZoG: [url=http://www.zoneofgames.ru/games/year_walk.html]ссылка[/url].

12801063.review:
"I don't love you anymore".

У всех нас в детстве были книги-панорамы: объёмные сценки раскрывались прямо перед нами как только мы перелистывали страницу. Year Walk во многом похожа на эти самые книги, вот только истории рассказывает совсем не детские.
Игра опирается на древнюю шведскую традицию, Årsgång (års - year; gång - walk), которая более не практикуется. Желающему совершить обряд нужно было на некоторое время запереться в комнате, отказавшись от еды и воды, а затем, в полночь, отправиться к церкви, обойти её три (или больше) раза, после чего подуть в замочную скважину и противостоять сверхъестественным силам. В обмен на все эти ужасы человек получал возможность увидеть отрывки своего будущего.
У Year Walk прекрасный баланс. Стиль, идея, саундтрек, загадки - всё это переплетается друг с другом и создаёт невероятную атмосферу мрачной, жуткой сказки. К слову, настоящий конец этой сказки мы узнаем только если вернёмся к Year Walk во второй раз.
Готовьтесь поломать свою память и сообразительность: это одна из тех игр, которую нужно проходить с блокнотом и карандашом под рукой. Так же есть пара действительно пугающих моментов, особо впечатлительные - будьте всегда наготове. 

Итак, что же в итоге? Year Walk - это прекрасная книга в не менее прекрасной обложке, которая однозначно стоит вашего внимания и времени.

북유럽의 전설을 재해석한 게임입니다. 이 게임을 통해 Year Walk라는 전설을 알게 되었네요. 전설부터가 소름이 끼치는데 그 전설을 접목해서인지 으스스한 분위기와 괴물들 탓에 심장이 쫄깃했습니다. 새벽에 이 게임을 했는데 진짜 저를 저주할 뻔했어요. 종종 갑툭튀하는 끔찍한 괴물들 때문에 어디를 가든 긴장을 늦출 수가 없었네요. 한국어는 지원되지 않지만 대사도 많이 나오지 않고 인터넷에 돌아다니는 공략 보면서 하느라 쉽게 깼습니다.
대도서관님도 이 게임을 하셨는데 그 분 덕에 헷갈리는 부분을 수월하게 깰 수 있었던 것 같네요.
저는 대부분 한국어 지원 게임밖에는 하지 않지만 그래도 나름 즐겁게 플레이했습니다. 첫번째 공략이 끝난 후에 다시 처음으로 돌아가는데 그게 끝인 줄 알고 진엔딩은 못 봤어요. 상자의 비밀을 풀면 진엔딩을 볼 수 있다던데 이거 하시는 분들은 꼭 진엔딩까지 보시기를 바랍니다.
플레이 시간은 비교적 짧아요. 시간 죽이기 용으로는 제격인 것 같네요.
시간 죽이기 용이라고만 하기에는 이 게임이 퀄리티가 좋지만요. 아무튼 즐거운 플레이하시가 바랍니다.

12386733.review:
A minimalist, atmospheric, pretty, challenging horror puzzle game.

Year Walk captures the eerie essence of a supernatural Scandinavian forest by night, and really succeeds in the horror aspect. There is a tension that accompanies the cold sounds and bleak environs. I was very impressed by the artistic style of Year Walk. It was minimalist, bleak but also beautiful. The colours aren't vibrant but they needn't be - hell they *shouldn't be*. This is the snowy wilderness of Scandinavia. I expect white, greys, blacks. Purples and reds are also used sparingly and effectively. The puzzles can be difficult, which I find helps the game a lot. It's a bit of a throwback to when games just sort of left you to it, with few or no hints. You're pretty much on your own in Year Walk, and I had to consult a walkthrough a couple of times. Some puzzles require some thought, and I found myself utilising the whole map to complete the puzzles, so no wasted space there at all. 


The story is a difficult aspect to critique because I feel the gameplay tells the story itself. So to critique the way I play the game is to critique the story. That being said, there is some backstory, which is told through some basic dialogue at the beginning of the game, and there is an encyclopaedia which accompanies you in the game, which is pretty critical to completing the game - but the information in the (very small) encyclopaedia helps give background also. I find this method of story telling to be quite innovative and also found it really help immerse me in the game. The controls are basic - arrow keys for navigation, mouse for point/click. Can't really go wrong there.

In conclusion, Year Walk is a quirky, beautiful little game. Not particularly long, but it achieves a lot in that short time, particularly in regards to puzzle solving, immersion, horror and artistry.

12361725.review:
It seems like Year Walk should be a hard game to recommend. Scary enough that people who aren't horror fans might not like it, but probably not scary at all to horror diehards. And it's short - finished my playthrough in about 2 hours, and aside from redoing one puzzle (that I can't go into detail on because spoilers), there's not much replay value.

But, I was impressed by how they used a somewhat cartoonish, paper cutout art style but still evoked a sense of dread. Puzzles were occasionally tricky but usually made sense after a few minutes of thinking about it. And I enjoyed the story and the various methods they used to narrate it. If you don't mind the price or can wait to get it on sale, it's worth a try.

11968679.review:
Страшно, атмосферно, сказочно. Именно эти три слова приходят в голову когда ты спрашиваешь себя "Чем эта игра так хороша?". Интерактивная новелла, симулятор ходьбы, красочный квест - всё это тоже справедливо относится к Year Walk, пронизанной шведским фольклором - преданиями и легендами о жутких существах и одной старой мрачной традицией. 

Что у нас с сюжетом? Подробности расписывать не буду, однако стоит сказать что следует сначала почитать дневник а потом уже приниматься за прохождение. Сюжет здесь подают кусочками в виде паззла, текста тут очень мало [что нехарактерно для квестов]. Игра недружелюбна и в плане геймплея - все элементы управления в правом верхнем углу экрана, имеются подсказки и карта, однако нужно самому понять что где использовать, кроме того, имеется пара неочевидных решений для некоторых задач. Чем действительно запоминается эта игра - так это своей атмосферой, которая пронизывает насквозь и не отпускает пока игра не будет пройдена до конца: мрачный холодный лес, хруст снега, странные создания, сладкое пение, записи в дневнике о старинных сказаниях, тяжелый топот неизвестного существа - погружение в игру просто потрясающее, которое усиливается двумя-тремя скримерами на весь экран в неожиданных местах. И что характерно, поиграть без звука не получится - некоторые задачи требуют вслушиваться в звуки окружения для того чтобы продвинуться дальше. Атмосфера и сюжет дополняются отличной рисованной графикой, подчеркивающей сказочность и таинственность происходящего. Однако как и любая сказка, Year Walk заканчивается довольно быстро - через 2-3 часа. В наличии две концовки: плохая и альтернативная [реалистичная, но очень плохая]. Если нет желания сидеть за монитором, можно поиграть в неё на мобильных устройствах, благо именно на них сначала состоялся релиз игры.

[i]Интерактивная сказка о шведских сказаниях. Страшно, атмосферно, сказочно.[/i]

Walk again?

The artwork is lovely, it's like walking through a creepy pop up book and it really sets the unsettling atmosphere along with the nice soundtrack. 11929881.review:
This game does something that very few pieces of media do well. This game manages to be simple in treatment and complex in subject matter. And do both very well at the same time. I really enjoyed my time with this short game. It has an achievement to get through the game in 20 minutes, and after a play through or two that's very very doable. The lore in the encyclopedia and the introduction of the journal in the second play through are wonderful. The puzzles are pretty nice too. I recommend not going into this one with a guide at first. The puzzles aren't anything that will make some one throw a keyboard or anything, but they are enough to make ya' scratch your head the first time you see them. This game is just so clever in how it chooses to do things. The closest thing I can think of to this game is Pan's Labyrinth. They're different as far as plot and what not, but their approach to the subject matter has the same kind of tone.

If you're looking for a short game that has some meat to it this is a great one to pick up. If you're looking for something outright terrifying you might want to look elsewhere.

11898989.review:
Year Walk - изумительная игра.

Опираясь на шведские поверья, фольклор и традиции, разработчики отправили игрока в незабываемое приключение. На самом деле такая традиция, в самом деле, существовала, не знаю, что там видели люди в своих походах, но от тех нескольких часов которые дарит нам игра невозможно оторваться.

Геймплей в одночасье хоть и простой, но в тоже время интересный, загадки в меру сложные, да и вообще геймплей, как и графика (которая, к слову очень красивая и отлично справляется со своей задачей). Главное в этой игре это атмосфера, при правильном подходе (наушники, выключенный свет, одиночество) она просто невероятная и не дает бросить от игры ни на миг. Хоррор элементы отлично пугают, но при этом не на столько, что бы бросить играть.

Вообще ставить оценки каким-то отдельным элементам игры довольно глупо, да и не нужно, это цельное произведение искусства которое просто может понравиться, или нет. Ну а как такое может не понравится я ума не приложу, нет конечно людям которые заходят в игры просто пострелять и поматерить тиммейтов, игра покажется скучной и неинтересной. Ну а другим, которые хотят получить от игр нечто большее, хотят чувствовать и сопереживать тому, что происходит на экране желаю как можно быстрее окунутся с головой в действия игры.

Концовка игры не оставит равнодушным никого и оставит под впечатлением на несколько часов. И да не закрывайте игру после титров и обязательно постарайтесь прочесть дневник вымышленного профессора.

Рекомендовать игру всем не могу, ну а так конечно - 10/10.

11883578.review: First off.. AMAZING GAME!! This is now one my favorite horror point&click puzzle games.  SO, basically you are doing a Year Walk which is a spiritual journey to discover the future, either bad or good.  It shows both 3d and 2d graphics and blends them together perfectly IMO. If you are like me and get into the storyline and the mood the creators try to portray, well you are in for a treat.  I was at the edge of my seat the entire time I played.  Its horror is really cool but not the typical horror of todays hollywood movies, but that just straight up creepy horror that sends chills down your spine.  If you are looking for a game that is fun and tests you, well here it is. You can use hints that they let you click but really, only use if you are extremely stuck and have no idea what to do next.  At the end of the game it never says "THE END" but there is an end. So pay attention, cause unlike most games that you just get up an walk away during the credits...THIS YOU WANT TO STAY! it gives you vital info that you will need for your next playthrough and to access parts of the game that can not be accesses without that info. SO ENJOY YOUR YEAR WALK...it just might be your last..MWUAHAHAH XD

11849358.review:
スウェーデンの古い伝承「Year Walk」を題材にしたホラーテイストな謎解きアドベンチャー

Year Walkとは、大晦日の深夜に森を歩き回ることで未来の啓示を得ることが出来るというという大昔の習慣のこと
主人公が、自身の将来を知るために、思いを寄せる彼女への告白の答えを知るためにYear Walkを行うというお話

スクリーンショットや動画を見てのとおり雪の降り積もる森がとても綺麗で、
スウェーデンの民話に登場する奇妙な生物達も相まって
神秘的で孤独感と異世界感が漂う探検の雰囲気はばっちり

Year Walk研究者による百貨事典などの脇を固める補助機能もよく出来ていて、
解説だけでなく、雰囲気作りにも一役買っている

ところどころ入る演出はすばらしく、音楽もいい

ストーリーの深い部分まで把握するには割りと英語力が必要
ただ、しっかり練られたストーリーなので、やるならば是非深いところまで追いかけてほしい

元々はiOS向けのゲームだけど、PC版では要素を追加したり謎解きなどをPC向けに調整しているみたい

11820432.review:
Очень атмосферно и интересно. Игра красивая, передает происходящее с помощью отличной рисованой графики.

Но важно понять - это чистейший StoryTelling жанр всего лишь с 7-ью загадками на всю игру (достаточно интересными, но не уберсложными). Если пройти всю игру, то повторное прохождение (уже зная как какие головоломки пройти) займет около 15 минут.

Но игра дешевая, часто попадает под скидки Steam, а потому вполне стоит своих денег. Важно понять - это сторителлинг на очень специфичную мистическую тему, это НЕ point-n-click жанр. Это не приключения или история любви типа To the Moon.

Единственный минус у этой игры - она до ужаса короткая. Нет, она РЕАЛЬНО короткая. Это не "Ой, Portal 2 намного короче первой части". Это если бы было "Во блин! Portal 2 соизмерим по времени с первой парой комнат первой части".

11777986.review: Year Walk is a horror puzzle game.  Yes it's an adventure too.  Some of the tasks you'll have to do is find keys, look for something hidden in the world, click things in a certain order...you know, typical puzzle stuff.  The game is in first-person but isn't like your typical first-person game.  It's best to watch videos about this game to know what I mean.  The controls are very simple and you just click items to interact with them.  The horror part of this game is mostly environmental.  It has an eerie feel to it and there's occasional jump scares.  I admit it's easy to get confused about the task at hand but you can always use the hints and map to get you in the right direction.  The artwork to this game is unique and adds to the feel of the game.  To me, between the music and artwork it feels like you're in a dream/nightmare.  If you like horror games you should give it a try.  This game isn't super scary but worth playing.

11734291.review:
Okay I want to start off by saying that as much as I wholeheartedly reccomend this game, it IS a horror game. I just finished a puzzle that ended in a really freaky jumpscare, and overall the atmosphere is really creepy and intense. If that's going to really freak you out or if you really can't stand games like that, this isn't the game for you.
Overall my reaction has been wholly positive so far, even if I did just get the pants scared off me. The art is gorgeous, the music is eerie but nice, and the controls are very simple, making for easy-to-learn gameplay. I don't think I'm close to finished quite yet, but between the art and the overall atmosphere of the game, I'm really enjoying playing.

And it's not just a horror game; it's a puzzle game. Puzzles that are original and unique from what I've seen in other games for the most part, and they aren't just random little things; everything seems to be fitting together, puzzles take you through many different areas of the game (thankfully there's a map), and there's an easy-to-use hint system that keeps me from getting frustrated by an 'unsolvable' puzzle. There does seem to be quite a bit of backtracking involved, as where you can move is limited (only side to side, and forwards/backwards only when there is a path), but I feel that that's a minor flaw in an otherwise entirely enjoyable game. I'll definitely be posting my full reaction to the game once I've finished, which will make for a more comprehensive review :)

11523211.review:
Небольшой, примерно на пару часов, сюрреалистичный квест в жанре триллера с небольшими элементами хоррора и прекрасно выдержанной атмосферой на мотив жутковатых скандинавских сказок. История главным образом связана с обрядом предсказания будущего [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%85rsg%C3%A5ng]Årsgång[/url] [i](Year walk)[/i], когда человек посредством определённых действий мог добраться до потусторонних сил и, пройдя их испытания, получал видения того, что случился в будущем году. 

Квестовые загадки в общем несложные, плюс есть развитая система подсказок. Как сами задания, так и встречаемые в игре существа тесно перекликаются с персонажами фольклора, вышедшего из язычества и попавшего под влияние христианства. Обо всём этом позже интересно почитать в небольшой игровой энциклопедии. 

После окончания игры даются толстые намёки на несколько взаимосвязанных секретов, позволяющих заглянуть в мета-сюжет, увлекательный детектив про то, как современный нам исследователь фольклора пытается разузнать о практически забытом ныне обряде Årsgång, и что из всего этого получается. В целом крепкие 5/5, рекомендую. Если не знаете английского языка, история, разумеется, потеряет в качестве, но сам по себе квест практически без диалогов.

11521069.review:
Surement l'un des jeux qui m'a le plus plut depuis longtemps. Le studio suédois Simogo nous invite à revivre l'aventure du jeu sur IOS sur un tout nouveau format pour le studio : le format PC. Pour l'occasion les développeurs ont rajouté du contenu exclusif à cette version comptant :
- Une carte complète du jeu 
- L'application Companion de la version IOS fait maintenant partis du jeu
- De nouveaux endroits à découvrir
- Un tout nouveau système d'indices pour ceux qui ne s'en sortent pas 
- Un menu de réglages
- Une navigation dans le jeu via les touches flèches et la souris
- Des succès faisant découvrir des secrets dans le jeu et pour augmenter la jouabilité du titre
- Des graphismes améliorés 
- Des puzzles différents de la version IOS
Bref, cette version du jeu est toute aussi intéressante que la version écran tactile qui procurait déjà une expérience formidable aussi bien dans ll'histoire q'au niveau de la patte graphique et de la bande-son. 
Dans ce jeu vous êtes un homme qui au début du jeu se rend dans un moulin pour renconter en secret son amour. Mais celle-ci lui annonce qu'un autre homme lui a proposé de l'épouser celle-ci devant lui donner sa réponse au nouvel an. L'homme se met en tête l'idée de faire un Year Walk une tradition aancestrale suédoise consistant à affronter diverses épreuves pour voir son futur. Notre homme lui veut voir ce qu'il va se passer pour la jeune femme et à la nuit tombé celui se lance dans l'aventure en pleine forêt suédoise. Il va devoir affronter des créatures folkloriques suédoises pour parvenir à ses fins et voir le futur. 
Une histoire qui m'a beaucoup plu notamment la fin ou plutôt les fins qui sont prenantes.
Le jeu possède égalemment une dose d'horreur avec quelques sursaut imprévisibles et la bande-son qui accompagne parfaitement chaque moment du jeu. Les graphismes définissent bien cette ambiance glauque et à la fois fantasique grâce à quelques jeux de lumières bien placés comme il faut.
Les énigmes plus ou mins corsées vous feront réfléchir vous faisant revenir plusieurs fois à un endroit pour trouver tout les indices vous menant à la solution finale. Préparez-vous cependant en mettant de côté un bloc-note et un stylo pour noter chaque indice. 

Bref une des expériences vidéoludiques les plus plaisantes à mon égard que je vous recommande chaudement pour avoir quelques frissons et passer un bon moment.

11516425.review:
Descending through Year Walk is liking having an ice cube put down the back of your shirt, then being pushed into the Artic Ocean. It's chilling and unnerving in a way that messes with your head, transcending its own existence into something that feels tangible; too close for comfort and so well crafted it causes you to second guess your own instincts that this is nothing but fantasy. As I sat staring at "The End" plastered across my screen, I could still feel my quickened pulse as I tried to shake the feeling of being on edge, something no piece of entertainment in any medium has managed in what feels like a very long time.

Year walking is a practice (largely found in Sweden) in which a ritual is performed by the walker through which they are given a glimpse through time at what the future holds. However, it comes at a grave cost, and there is no guarantee the walker will  even make it through alive.

Walking through a forest at midnight, snow blanketing the ground around you, you come face to face with the horrors that befall those that dare to year walk: The Watchers, twisted and greedy spirits, who demand their sacrifice for showing you what is to come. The deeper you get, the more vile and disturbing these encounters become, before you finally enter the church and see your fate.

This is when the game first ends, but it also marks the point at which the game truly begins. Up to this point you've been bustled along through this story with little in the way of explanation or reason. It's artistically brilliant and frightening to be sure, but all the same largely disconnected and without any real purpose, meant to alarm but ultimately lacking any substance. It's not then until you begin to walk again and the curtain is pulled away that the pieces fall into place and the true meaning behind your circumstances become clear. Terrifyingly so.

Year Walk is a master at what it tries to be. It lets nothing on and leaves you wandering in the dark for a good while, which only makes it more unnerving when it finally lays its cards on the table. The expert use of Swedish folklore ties its world and ours together as it attempts to break the forth wall as it weaves together fantasy and psychological horror into a brief but immensely compelling narrative. If you've gotten this far you've likely realized I've said a lot of nothing in all these words, and that's entirely intentional, as to say what makes Year Walk so brilliant would be to completely ruin it the experience. No, this is one walk that you have to take for yourself, though I promise you won't regret it.

[b]You can read more of my writing on [url=http://kritiqal.com/2014/08/02/year-walk-review/]Kritiqal[/url].[/b]

11509321.review:
[b][h1]MAGIA PURA[/h1][/b]
Year Walk es uno de tantos ejemplos en donde los videojuegos se convierten en obras de arte. Una intrigante mezcla narrativa, entre mítica y épica, mostrada con gráficos de ensueño, salidos de una vieja [i]-y oscura-[/i] película de suspenso.
La historia nos mete de lleno en la mitología escandinava, en una trama donde nuestro protagonista tiene que "sencillamente" encontrarse con seres míticos mientras camina por el bosque. La recompensa será poder cambiar el futuro... o no.
Una mecánica de juego tomada de las grandes aventuras de antaño, con puzzles de exploración al mejor estilo [i]Myst[/i], que nos obligan a llevar una libretita con anotaciones, dibujos y pistas que vemos a lo largo del viaje. 
En sus dos horas de duración Year Walk nos brinda sustos, sobresaltos, atmósferas oscuras, laberintos intrigantes y una sensación que previene su increíble final. Incluso después de terminar el juego por primera vez, el desarrollador nos da la oportunidad de resolver un último puzzle y develar el "verdadero" final del juego.
Me cuesta encontrar puntos débiles en esta producción, pero puedo decir que quizás los efectos sonoros podrían haber estado mejor. Igual, hay que tener en cuenta que fue desarrollado por una compañía indie de muy pocas personas, en Suecia.
En resumen, Year Walk es como esos bocados deliciosos que disfrutamos y sin importar el tiempo que nos lleve degustarlo, siempre queremos más. [b]Nota: 9.5/10[/b]
